parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^PrimaryGS time shift v1.1^
:enablep NIL
:name SHIFT
:value_tab 40
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE DEFINE)) RULE1 (= (VALUE (QUOTE DEFINE)) 1) (PROGN (DO_SHOW (QUOTE HEADERNAME)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE CONSTANT)))) (((VALUE DEFINE)) RULE2 (= (VALUE (QUOTE DEFINE)) 2) (PROGN (DO_SHOW (QUOTE CONSTANT)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE HEADERNAME)))))
:exec_data (^SOCKET_TOOL^ (^GENERAL^ (^program^ :implicit ^PGSshiftv1.1.exe^) (^DEFINE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE DEFINE))) (^HEADERNAME^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE HEADERNAME))) (^CONSTANT^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CONSTANT))) (^ACTION^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ACTION))))):parameter DEFINE
:text ^Define time shift^
:plot_label T
:type :choose
:type_desc ((^Header^ 1 ^Use header value^) (^Constant^ 2 ^Specify a constant^))
:selected_item (^Constant^ 2 ^Specify a constant^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^choose header or constant to define time shift^
:parameter HEADERNAME
:text ^Header name^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 256)
:value ^^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Specify the name of the header that contains the time shift value.^
:parameter CONSTANT
:text ^constant time shift^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 128)
:value ^1^
:mouse_text ^Specify a constant time shift. ^
:parameter ACTION
:text ^Action^
:type :choose
:type_desc ((^Apply^ 1 ^Apply time shift^) (^Remove^ 2 ^Remove time shift^))
:selected_item (^Apply^ 1 ^Apply time shift^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Decide type of action.^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Datum Statics Calculation*^
:enablep NIL
:name DATUM_STAT_CALC
:value_tab 35
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE STATTYPE)) RULE1ELEV (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE METHOD)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE METHOD))) (((VALUE STATTYPE)) RULE1REFR (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE METHOD1)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE METHOD1))) (((VALUE STATTYPE) (VALUE METHOD)) RULE2ELEV (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 1) (= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 3)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE MATHFILE)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE MATHFILE))) (((VALUE STATTYPE) (VALUE METHOD1)) RULE2REFR (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 2) (= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD1)) 2)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE MATHFIL1)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE MATHFIL1))) (((VALUE NSMOOTH)) RULE3 (EVENP (VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH))) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH) (+ (VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH)) 1))) (((VALUE STATTYPE) (VALUE METHOD)) RULE4 (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 1) (= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 2)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE W_VELOC)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE W_VELOC))) (((VALUE STATTYPE)) RULE5 (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (S_STATIC R_STATIC))) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE (S_STATIC R_STATIC)))) (((VALUE S_STATIC)) RULE1_CALL_DBPARM (VALUE (QUOTE S_STATIC)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE S_STATIC) NIL) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE S_STATIC) NIL) (SET_TYPE_DESC (QUOTE S_STATIC) (LIST (CHOOSE_OLD_DB_PARM))))) (((VALUE R_STATIC)) RULE1_CALL_DBPARM (VALUE (QUOTE R_STATIC)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE R_STATIC) NIL) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE R_STATIC) NIL) (SET_TYPE_DESC (QUOTE R_STATIC) (LIST (CHOOSE_OLD_DB_PARM))))))
:exec_data (^DATUM_STAT_CALC^ (^SPECIAL^ (^TOOLTYPE^ :implicit ^STAND_ALONE^) (^PATHNAME^ :implicit ^datum_stat_calc.exe^) (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: datum_stat_calc.menu 49485 2013-08-28 04:40:05Z Chris Jones $^) (^MATHFILE^ :implicit (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 1) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/elev_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 2) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/noup_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 4) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/surf_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 3) (VALUE (QUOTE MATHFILE))))) (^STATTYPE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE))) (^METHOD^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD))) (^W_VELOC^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE W_VELOC))) (^FNL_ELEV^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE FNL_ELEV))) (^REPL_VEL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE REPL_VEL))) (^NMO_METH^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE NMO_METH))) (^NSMOOTH^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH))) (^S_STATIC^ :implicit (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE S_STATIC)))) (^R_STATIC^ :implicit (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE R_STATIC)))) (^DATUM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE DATUM1))) (^DB_NUM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE DB_NUM))) (^MATHFIL1^ :implicit (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD1)) 1) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/ref_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD1)) 2) (VALUE (QUOTE MATHFIL1))))))):parameter STATTYPE
:text ^Elevation or Refraction^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Elevation^ 1 ^Compute Elevation statics to final datum.^) (^Refraction^ 2 ^Input Refraction statics to final datum^))
:selected_item (^Elevation^ 1 ^Compute Elevation statics to final datum.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Elevation will compute shot, recv and cdp statics -- Refraction will copy shot and rcvr but compute cdp statics^
:parameter FNL_ELEV
:text ^Final datum elevation^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 16)
:value ^0^
:mouse_text ^Enter final datum elevation constant value or PARAMETER from the SRF GEOMETRY DataBase. See help for other suggestions.^
:parameter REPL_VEL
:text ^Replacement velocity^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 16)
:value ^2000^
:mouse_text ^Enter replacement velocity constant value or PARAMETER from the SRF GEOMETRY DataBase. See help for other suggestions.^
:parameter METHOD
:text ^Database math method for elevation statics^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Shot Holes Using Uphole Info^ 1 ^Do database math by conventional method (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/elev_stat_math).^) (^Shot Holes Ignoring Upholes Times^ 2 ^Do database math using weathering velocity to compute uphole times (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/noup_stat_math).^) (^Surface Source^ 4 ^Do database math without shot depths and uphole times (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/surf_stat_math).^) (^Other (user-defined)^ 3 ^Do database math using some other method (user-defined stat_math file).^))
:selected_item (^Surface Source^ 4 ^Do database math without shot depths and uphole times (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/surf_stat_math).^)
:value 4
:mouse_text ^Select the method to use to compute the statics. The different methods have slightly different computation algoriths^
:parameter METHOD1
:text ^Database math method for refraction statics^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Use the default ref_stat_math file^ 1 ^Do database math by conventional method (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/ref_stat_math).^) (^Other (user-defined)^ 2 ^Do database math using some other method (user-defined stat_math file).^))
:selected_item (^Use the default ref_stat_math file^ 1 ^Do database math by conventional method (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/ref_stat_math).^)
:value 1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select the math_file to be used for working with the refraction statics.^
:parameter W_VELOC
:text ^ Specify Weathering velocity^
:type :edit
:type_desc (30 80 5 ^ :FORMAT Groups of 'STATION:Weathering Velocity /' values
 EXAMPLE: 101:3500 / 242:3800 / 440:4400 /
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 3)
:value ^101:3000/201:3500/351:4000/^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Enter groups of STATION-Weathering Velocity values. **SEE EXAMPLE!!!**^
:parameter MATHFILE
:text ^ Database math file for elevation statics^
:type :edit
:type_desc (31 80 5 ^ :Format / 'path' / 'filename' 
 :Example /usr/joepro/elev_stat_method2^)
:value ^/promax_home/port/misc/elev_stat_math^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^This specifies the name of the file that is used for database math to generate elevation statics.^
:parameter MATHFIL1
:text ^Database math file for refraction statics^
:type :edit
:type_desc (31 80 5 ^ :Format / 'path' / 'filename' 
 :Example /usr/johndoe/ref_stat_method2^)
:value ^/promax_home/port/misc/ref_stat_math^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Specify the file name for the appropriate refraction static solution calculation.^
:parameter NMO_METH
:text ^NMO static method^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Elevations^ 1 ^Use the smoothed surface elevations (NMO datum).^) (^Mean Statics^ 2 ^Use the smoothed mean of source and receiver statics of contributing traces in a CDP.^))
:selected_item (^Mean Statics^ 2 ^Use the smoothed mean of source and receiver statics of contributing traces in a CDP.^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^Select the method for creating the NMO statics. See the help file for more explanation.^
:parameter NSMOOTH
:text ^Length of smoother^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 4 1 NIL)
:value 51
:mouse_text ^Enter the length of the smoother (in CDPs). Use an odd number.^
:parameter S_STATIC
:text ^Select SOURCE statics^
:type :action
:type_desc (^INVALID^)
:selected_item :none
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a SOURCE Statics file description (SDRM, SDLT, SGRM)from the SIN GEOMETRY database.^
:parameter R_STATIC
:text ^Select RECEIVER statics^
:type :action
:type_desc (^INVALID^)
:selected_item :none
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a RECEIVER Statics file description (RDRM, RDLT, RGRM)from the SRF GEOMETRY database.^
:parameter DATUM1
:text ^Processing DATUM^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^NMO DATUM^ 1 ^Compute non-zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to Smooth Surface (N_DATUM)^) (^FINAL DATUM^ 2 ^Compute zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to FINAL DATUM. NMO_DATUM = FINAL DATUM^))
:selected_item (^NMO DATUM^ 1 ^Compute non-zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to Smooth Surface (N_DATUM)^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select datum to which the data will be referenced after running Apply Datum Statics.^
:parameter DB_NUM
:text ^Run ID^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 2)
:value ^01^
:mouse_text ^Enter a 2 characters (number) identifying the database output parameters as S_STATXX, R_STATXX, C_STATXX and N_DATMXX^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Datum Statics Apply^
:enablep T
:name DATUM_STAT_APPLY
:value_tab 45
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE S_STATIC)) RULE1_CALL_DBPARM (VALUE (QUOTE S_STATIC)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE S_STATIC) NIL) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE S_STATIC) NIL) (SET_TYPE_DESC (QUOTE S_STATIC) (LIST (CHOOSE_OLD_DB_PARM))))) (((VALUE R_STATIC)) RULE2_CALL_DBPARM (VALUE (QUOTE R_STATIC)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE R_STATIC) NIL) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE R_STATIC) NIL) (SET_TYPE_DESC (QUOTE R_STATIC) (LIST (CHOOSE_OLD_DB_PARM))))) (((VALUE C_STATIC)) RULE3_CALL_DBPARM (VALUE (QUOTE C_STATIC)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE C_STATIC) NIL) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE C_STATIC) NIL) (SET_TYPE_DESC (QUOTE C_STATIC) (LIST (CHOOSE_OLD_DB_PARM))))) (((VALUE N_DATUM)) RULE4_CALL_DBPARM (VALUE (QUOTE N_DATUM)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE N_DATUM) NIL) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE N_DATUM) NIL) (SET_TYPE_DESC (QUOTE N_DATUM) (LIST (CHOOSE_OLD_DB_PARM))))))
:exec_data (^DATUM_STAT_APPLY^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^:ProMAX $Id datum_stat_apply.menu 44577 2009-07-29 16:44:43Z David :Johnston $ $Revision :44577 $ $Date 2009-07-29 10:44:43 -0600 (Wed, 29 Jul 2009) $^) (^S_STATIC^ :implicit (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE S_STATIC)))) (^R_STATIC^ :implicit (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE R_STATIC)))) (^C_STATIC^ :implicit (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE C_STATIC)))) (^N_DATUM^ :implicit (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE N_DATUM)))))):parameter S_STATIC
:text ^ Source datum statics database parameter^
:type :action
:type_desc (^SIN GEOMETRY S_STAT01^)
:selected_item :none
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to specify the SOURCE elevation/refraction datum statics parameter to read from the database and apply to the input traces.^
:parameter R_STATIC
:text ^ Receiver datum statics database parameter^
:type :action
:type_desc (^SRF GEOMETRY R_STAT01^)
:selected_item :none
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to specify the RECEIVER elevation/refraction datum statics parameter to read from the database and apply to input traces.^
:parameter C_STATIC
:text ^ CDP datum statics database parameter^
:type :action
:type_desc (^CDP GEOMETRY C_STAT01^)
:selected_item :none
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to specify the CDP elevation/refraction datum statics parameter to read from the database and apply to input traces.^
:parameter N_DATUM
:text ^ NMO Datum Source ^
:type :action
:type_desc (^CDP GEOMETRY N_DATM01^)
:selected_item :none
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to specify the CDP elevation/refraction NMO datum parameter to read from the database and apply to the input traces.^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Normal Moveout Correction^
:enablep T
:name NMO
:value_tab 50
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE DIRECT)) RULE1 (= (VALUE (QUOTE DIRECT)) -1) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE DO_STAT)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE DO_STAT))) (((VALUE DIRECT)) STR_MUTE_MOUSE_TEXT (= (VALUE (QUOTE DIRECT)) 1) (SET_MOUSE_TEXT (QUOTE STR_MUTE) ^Any sample stretched more than this percentage will be automatically muted (enter 0.0 to disable).^) (SET_MOUSE_TEXT (QUOTE STR_MUTE) ^For INVERSE NMO, this parameter only affects the reset of the mute header entries (enter 0.0 to disable reset).^)) (NIL OVERLAY_CHECK T (IF (NOT (VALUE (QUOTE OVERLAY1))) (PROGN (IF (AND (OR (EQUAL (SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE LONGOFFS)) (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE LONGOFFS)))) (= (VALUE (QUOTE LONGOFFS)) 0)) (NOT (= (VALUE (QUOTE ETA)) 0.0))) (PROGN (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE LONGOFFS2) (FOURTH (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE LONGOFFS2)))) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE LONGOFFS2) 4))) (IF (OR (EQUAL (SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE LONGOFFS)) (SECOND (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE LONGOFFS)))) (= (VALUE (QUOTE LONGOFFS)) 1)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE LONGOFFS2) 1) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE LONGOFFS2) (SECOND (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE LONGOFFS2)))))) (IF (OR (EQUAL (SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE LONGOFFS)) (THIRD (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE LONGOFFS)))) (= (VALUE (QUOTE LONGOFFS)) 2)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE LONGOFFS2) 2) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE LONGOFFS2) (THIRD (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE LONGOFFS2)))))) (IF (OR (EQUAL (SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE LONGOFFS)) (FOURTH (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE LONGOFFS)))) (= (VALUE (QUOTE LONGOFFS)) 3)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE LONGOFFS2) 3) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE LONGOFFS2) (FIFTH (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE LONGOFFS2)))))) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE OVERLAY1) (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE OVERLAY1)))) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE OVERLAY1) T)))) (((SHOWP IDIP_VEL) (VALUE IDIP_VEL)) VEL_OPT (AND (SHOWING (QUOTE IDIP_VEL)) (VALUE (QUOTE IDIP_VEL))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE VEL_OPTION)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE VEL_OPTION))) (((SHOWP IDIP_VEL) (VALUE IDIP_VEL)) BIN_CTR (AND (SHOWING (QUOTE IDIP_VEL)) (VALUE (QUOTE IDIP_VEL)) (= (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^I3Dz^) 1)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE IBIN_CTR)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE IBIN_CTR))) (NIL BIN_CTR_OFF (= (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^I3Dz^) 0) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE IBIN_CTR) NIL)) (((SHOWP IDIP_VEL) (VALUE IDIP_VEL)) DIPVELS (AND (SHOWING (QUOTE IDIP_VEL)) (VALUE (QUOTE IDIP_VEL))) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE VEL_OPTION) T) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE VEL_OPTION) (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE VEL_OPTION)))) (SET_TYPE_DESC (QUOTE VELNAME) (QUOTE ((PARM_LIST ^DVA^) PARMS)))) (SET_TYPE_DESC (QUOTE VELNAME) (QUOTE ((PARM_LIST ^VEL^) PARMS)))) (((VALUE IDIP_VEL) (SHOWP IDIP_VEL) (VALUE DIRECT)) PARTIAL_NMO (OR (AND (VALUE (QUOTE IDIP_VEL)) (SHOWING (QUOTE IDIP_VEL))) (= (VALUE (QUOTE DIRECT)) -1)) (PROGN (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE IPARTIAL)) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE IPARTIAL) NIL) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE IPARTIAL) (SECOND (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE IPARTIAL))))) (PROGN (DO_SHOW (QUOTE IPARTIAL)))) (((VALUE IPARTIAL) (SHOWP IPARTIAL)) PART_HDR (AND (VALUE (QUOTE IPARTIAL)) (SHOWING (QUOTE IPARTIAL))) (PROGN (DO_SHOW (QUOTE PART_HDR)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE LONGOFFS2))) (PROGN (DO_SHOW (QUOTE LONGOFFS2)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE PART_HDR)))) (((SHOWP IDIP_VEL) (VALUE IDIP_VEL) (VALUE IPSV_NMO) (SHOWP IPARTIAL) (VALUE IPARTIAL)) LONGOFFS (OR (OR (AND (SHOWING (QUOTE IDIP_VEL)) (VALUE (QUOTE IDIP_VEL))) (VALUE (QUOTE IPSV_NMO))) (AND (SHOWING (QUOTE IPARTIAL)) (VALUE (QUOTE IPARTIAL)))) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE LONGOFFS2)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE LONGOFFS2))) (((SHOWP LONGOFFS2) (VALUE LONGOFFS2)) ETA (AND (SHOWING (QUOTE LONGOFFS2)) (> (VALUE (QUOTE LONGOFFS2)) 2)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE ETASRC)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE ETASRC))) (((VALUE ETASRC) (SHOWP ETASRC)) ETATOGGLE1 (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE ETASRC)) 1) (SHOWING (QUOTE ETASRC))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE ETA)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE ETA))) (((VALUE ETASRC) (SHOWP ETASRC)) ETATOGGLE2 (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE ETASRC)) 2) (SHOWING (QUOTE ETASRC))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE ETANAME)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE ETANAME))) (((VALUE VEL_OPTION)) VELFIELD2D (VALUE (QUOTE VEL_OPTION)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE VELFIELD)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE VELFIELD))) (((VALUE VEL_OPTION)) VELNAME2D (VALUE (QUOTE VEL_OPTION)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE VELNAME)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE VELNAME))) (((VALUE VELFIELD)) VEL_DEFAULT_RULE1 (AND (EQUAL (VALUE (QUOTE VELFIELD)) ^XXX^) (= (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^IUNITSz^) 1)) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE VELFIELD) ^1:0-5000,1000-7500,2000-9500,3000-11500,4000-14000,6000-18000,8000-22000/^)) (((VALUE VELFIELD)) VEL_DEFAULT_RULE2 (EQUAL (VALUE (QUOTE VELFIELD)) ^XXX^) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE VELFIELD) ^1:0-1480,1000-2500,2000-3200,3000-4000,4000-4500,6000-6000,8000-7000/^)))
:exec_data (^NMO^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: nmo.menu 47634 2011-11-07 20:57:29Z Ted Shuck $ $Revision: 47634 $ $Date: 2011-11-07 14:57:29 -0600 (Mon, 07 Nov 2011) $^) (^NUM_WAYS^ :implicit 2) (^DIRECT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE DIRECT))) (^IDIP_VEL^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IDIP_VEL)) 1 0)) (^IBIN_CTR^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IBIN_CTR)) 1 0)) (^PSV_NMO ^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IPSV_NMO)) 1 0)) (^LONGOFFS^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE LONGOFFS2))) (^IPARTIAL^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IPARTIAL)) 1 0)) (^PART_HDR^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE PART_HDR))) (^VELNAME ^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE VEL_OPTION)) (VALUE (QUOTE VELNAME)) ^NONE ^)) (^VELFIELD^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE VELFIELD))) (^DO_STAT ^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE DO_STAT)) 1 0)) (^NMO_APLD^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE NMO_APLD)) 1 0)) (^STR_MUTE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE STR_MUTE))) (^ETASRC ^ :implicit (IF (SHOWING (QUOTE ETASRC)) (VALUE (QUOTE ETASRC)) 1)) (^ETA ^ :implicit (IF (SHOWING (QUOTE ETA)) (VALUE (QUOTE ETA)) 0.0)) (^ETANAME ^ :implicit (IF (SHOWING (QUOTE ETANAME)) (VALUE (QUOTE ETANAME)) ^NONE ^)))):parameter DIRECT
:text ^Direction for NMO application^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^FORWARD^ 1 ^Apply NMO... this is the normal application mode.^) (^INVERSE^ -1 ^Back off (remove) previously applied NMO.^))
:selected_item (^FORWARD^ 1 ^Apply NMO... this is the normal application mode.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Normally use FORWARD, but you can also remove (INVERSE) previously applied NMO.^
:parameter STR_MUTE
:text ^ Stretch mute percentage^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 7 0.0 NIL)
:value 30.0
:mouse_text ^Any sample stretched more than this percentage will be automatically muted (enter 0.0 to disable).^
:parameter DO_STAT
:text ^ Apply any remaining static during NMO?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^If 'Yes', accumulated NA_STAT header word statics (such as the floating datum static) will be applied during NMO.^
:parameter NMO_APLD
:text ^ Disable check for previously applied NMO?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Normally, you will not want to apply NMO twice, but some exceptions may exist.^
:parameter IDIP_VEL
:text ^Get 3D dip velocities?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' if applying 3D NMO dip velocity correction.^
:parameter IBIN_CTR
:text ^ Apply bin center corrections?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^User may decide if the bin center corrections are to be applied as part of the 3D dip/velocity NMO.^
:parameter IPARTIAL
:text ^Apply partial NMO?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^You may correct the trace to something other than zero offset for processes that require apparent constant offset.^
:parameter PART_HDR
:text ^ Header entry with desired non-zero offset^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc (HEADER_LIST HEADERS)
:selected_item ^Offset bin center^
:value ^OFB_CNTR^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select a header entry from the headers menu that contains the desired non-zero offset.^
:parameter IPSV_NMO
:text ^Apply P-Sv converted-wave NMO?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^You may apply a P-Sv converted-wave NMO correction.^
:parameter LONGOFFS
:text ^Long offset correction?^
:type :choose
:type_desc ((^NONE^ 0 ^Apply only two term NMO (normal application).^) (^ALCHALABI^ 1 ^Apply Al-Chalabi's third term (fastest).^) (^CASTLE^ 2 ^Apply Castle's shifted hyperbola (slow, least accurate).^) (^TSVANKIN^ 3 ^Apply Tsvankin and Thomsen's third term (slow, most accurate).^))
:selected_item (^NONE^ 0 ^Apply only two term NMO (normal application).^)
:value 0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Choose desired method for long-offset correction.^
:parameter OVERLAY1
:text ^Has menu been overlayed?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^After initial overlay processing this is toggled to prevent repetition^
:parameter LONGOFFS2
:text ^Long offset correction?^
:plot_label T
:type :choose
:type_desc ((^NONE^ 0 ^Apply only two term NMO (normal application).^) (^ALCHALABI^ 1 ^Apply Al-Chalabi's third term (fastest).^) (^CASTLE^ 2 ^Apply Castle's shifted hyperbola (slow, least accurate).^) (^HARLAN^ 4 ^Apply Harlan's anisotropic third term (slower, good accuracy).^) (^TSVANKIN^ 3 ^Apply Tsvankin and Thomsen's third term (slowest, most accurate).^))
:selected_item (^TSVANKIN^ 3 ^Apply Tsvankin and Thomsen's third term (slowest, most accurate).^)
:value 3
:mouse_text ^Choose desired method for long-offset correction.^
:parameter ETASRC
:text ^ Constant or variable ETA anisotropy?^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Constant^ 1 ^Constant value for ETA^) (^Variable^ 2 ^ETA is retrieved from a table^))
:selected_item (^Constant^ 1 ^Constant value for ETA^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Source of ETA anisotropy correction parameter^
:parameter ETA
:text ^ Anisotropy correction parameter ETA^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 6 -0.25 1.0)
:value 0.0
:mouse_text ^Value of zero means no anisotropy correction. Normally nonnegative and less than 0.1^
:parameter ETANAME
:text ^ Parameter table with ETA parameters^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc ((PARM_LIST ^ETA^) PARMS)
:selected_item ^INVALID^
:value ^no entry^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select an ETA parameter file for anisotropic corrections.^
:properties (:supported_formats ^PROMAX^
 )
:parameter VEL_OPTION
:text ^Get velocities from the database?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' if there is an appropriate NMO stacking velocity function in the database as a parameter file.^
:parameter VELNAME
:text ^ SELECT Velocity parameter file^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc ((PARM_LIST ^VEL^) PARMS)
:selected_item ^terrex_field_1D^
:value ^79991180^
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a velocity function parameter file from the parameter file menu.^
:properties (:supported_formats (^JAVASEIS^ ^PROMAX^)
 )
:parameter VELFIELD
:text ^ SPECIFY NMO velocity function(s)^
:plot_label T
:type :edit
:type_desc (20 80 15 ^ FORMAT: CDP1:T1-V1,T2-V2,...,Tn-Vn/CDP2:T1-V1,T2-V2,...,Tn-Vn/
 EXAMPLE: 1:0-5000,900-6725,1500-8571,2000-9670/101:0-5100,860-6690,2000-9852/
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 3)
:value ^1:0-1480,1000-2500,2000-3200,3000-4000,4000-4500,6000-6000,8000-7000/^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to edit/define normal moveout velocity functions. (SEE EDITOR FOR EXAMPLES.)^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Automatic Gain Control^
:enablep T
:name AGC
:value_tab 35
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE MODE_APP)) APPLICATION (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE_APP)) 3) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE (MODE_AMP AGCLEN MODE_WIN MODE_OPTION ROBUST_OPTION))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (MODE_AMP AGCLEN MODE_WIN MODE_OPTION ROBUST_OPTION)))) (((VALUE ROBUST_OPTION) (SHOWP ROBUST_OPTION)) ROBUST (AND (VALUE (QUOTE ROBUST_OPTION)) (SHOWING (QUOTE ROBUST_OPTION))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE ROBUST)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE ROBUST))))
:exec_data ((^AGC^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: agc.menu 44577 2009-07-29 16:44:43Z David Johnston $ $Revision: 44577 $ $Date: 2009-07-29 11:44:43 -0500 (Wed, 29 Jul 2009) $^) (^MODE_APP^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE MODE_APP))) (^MODE_AMP^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE MODE_AMP))) (^AGCLEN^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE AGCLEN))) (^MODE_WIN^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE MODE_WIN))) (^MODEZERO^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE MODE_OPTION)) 1 0)) (^ROBUST ^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE ROBUST_OPTION)) (VALUE (QUOTE ROBUST)) 0.0)))) ((IF (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE_APP)) 3) ^HDR_DELETE^ ^VOID^) (^GENERAL^ (^HDR_NAME^ :implicit ^AGC_SCAL^)))):parameter MODE_APP
:text ^Application mode^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^APPLY ^ 1 ^Apply Automatic Gain Control scalars only.^) (^APPLY & SAVE ^ 2 ^Apply Automatic Gain Control scalars AND save scalars in header.^) (^REMOVE AGC ^ 3 ^Remove Automatic Gain Control scalars stored in header AND delete header.^) (^OUTPUT SCALARS^ 4 ^Output the AGC scalar values as traces.^))
:selected_item (^APPLY ^ 1 ^Apply Automatic Gain Control scalars only.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select AGC only, AGC and save scalars, or remove a previously saved AGC operation.^
:parameter MODE_AMP
:text ^Type of AGC scalar^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^MEAN^ 1 ^Base the AGC scalar on the MEAN of the absolute values of the samples in the sliding time gate.^) (^RMS ^ 2 ^Base the AGC scalar on the Root Mean Square of the sample values in the sliding time gate.^) (^MEDIAN^ 3 ^Base the AGC scalar on the median of the sample values in the sliding time gate.^))
:selected_item (^MEAN^ 1 ^Base the AGC scalar on the MEAN of the absolute values of the samples in the sliding time gate.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^AGC scalars can be computed using the MEAN, RMS, or MEDIAN of the samples in the sliding time gate.^
:parameter AGCLEN
:text ^AGC operator length^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 7 1.0E-5 NIL)
:value 500.0
:mouse_text ^Amplitude estimation operator length in milliseconds for sliding gate AGC.^
:parameter MODE_WIN
:text ^BASIS for scalar application^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Centered^ 2 ^Apply computed gain scalar to the CENTER sample of the gate (MOST COMMON MODE!).^) (^Trailing^ 1 ^Apply computed gain scalar to the FIRST (earliest in time) sample in the gate.^) (^Leading^ 3 ^Apply computed gain scalar to the LAST (latest in time) sample in the gate.^))
:selected_item (^Centered^ 2 ^Apply computed gain scalar to the CENTER sample of the gate (MOST COMMON MODE!).^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^For normal operations CENTERED should be used. TRAILING and LEADING will distort waveforms.^
:parameter MODE_OPTION
:text ^Exclude hard zeroes?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^'Hard zeroes' (0.0 values) may be excluded from scalar computations. This avoids strange mute effects.^
:parameter ROBUST_OPTION
:text ^Robust Scaling?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' to limit the AGC scaling to be within a factor of the median scalar.^
:parameter ROBUST
:text ^ Maximum scaling factor^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 7 1.0 NIL)
:value 20.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Forces the AGC scale factor to be within this factor of the median scalar.^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Datum Statics Calculation*^
:enablep NIL
:name DATUM_STAT_CALC
:value_tab 35
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE STATTYPE)) RULE1ELEV (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE METHOD)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE METHOD))) (((VALUE STATTYPE)) RULE1REFR (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE METHOD1)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE METHOD1))) (((VALUE STATTYPE) (VALUE METHOD)) RULE2ELEV (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 1) (= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 3)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE MATHFILE)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE MATHFILE))) (((VALUE STATTYPE) (VALUE METHOD1)) RULE2REFR (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 2) (= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD1)) 2)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE MATHFIL1)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE MATHFIL1))) (((VALUE NSMOOTH)) RULE3 (EVENP (VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH))) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH) (+ (VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH)) 1))) (((VALUE STATTYPE) (VALUE METHOD)) RULE4 (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 1) (= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 2)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE W_VELOC)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE W_VELOC))) (((VALUE STATTYPE)) RULE5 (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (S_STATIC R_STATIC))) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE (S_STATIC R_STATIC)))) (((VALUE S_STATIC)) RULE1_CALL_DBPARM (VALUE (QUOTE S_STATIC)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE S_STATIC) NIL) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE S_STATIC) NIL) (SET_TYPE_DESC (QUOTE S_STATIC) (LIST (CHOOSE_OLD_DB_PARM))))) (((VALUE R_STATIC)) RULE1_CALL_DBPARM (VALUE (QUOTE R_STATIC)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE R_STATIC) NIL) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE R_STATIC) NIL) (SET_TYPE_DESC (QUOTE R_STATIC) (LIST (CHOOSE_OLD_DB_PARM))))))
:exec_data (^DATUM_STAT_CALC^ (^SPECIAL^ (^TOOLTYPE^ :implicit ^STAND_ALONE^) (^PATHNAME^ :implicit ^datum_stat_calc.exe^) (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: datum_stat_calc.menu 49485 2013-08-28 04:40:05Z Chris Jones $^) (^MATHFILE^ :implicit (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 1) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/elev_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 2) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/noup_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 4) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/surf_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 3) (VALUE (QUOTE MATHFILE))))) (^STATTYPE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE))) (^METHOD^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD))) (^W_VELOC^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE W_VELOC))) (^FNL_ELEV^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE FNL_ELEV))) (^REPL_VEL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE REPL_VEL))) (^NMO_METH^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE NMO_METH))) (^NSMOOTH^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH))) (^S_STATIC^ :implicit (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE S_STATIC)))) (^R_STATIC^ :implicit (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE R_STATIC)))) (^DATUM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE DATUM1))) (^DB_NUM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE DB_NUM))) (^MATHFIL1^ :implicit (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD1)) 1) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/ref_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD1)) 2) (VALUE (QUOTE MATHFIL1))))))):parameter STATTYPE
:text ^Elevation or Refraction^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Elevation^ 1 ^Compute Elevation statics to final datum.^) (^Refraction^ 2 ^Input Refraction statics to final datum^))
:selected_item (^Refraction^ 2 ^Input Refraction statics to final datum^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^Elevation will compute shot, recv and cdp statics -- Refraction will copy shot and rcvr but compute cdp statics^
:parameter FNL_ELEV
:text ^Final datum elevation^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 16)
:value ^0^
:mouse_text ^Enter final datum elevation constant value or PARAMETER from the SRF GEOMETRY DataBase. See help for other suggestions.^
:parameter REPL_VEL
:text ^Replacement velocity^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 16)
:value ^2000^
:mouse_text ^Enter replacement velocity constant value or PARAMETER from the SRF GEOMETRY DataBase. See help for other suggestions.^
:parameter METHOD
:text ^Database math method for elevation statics^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Shot Holes Using Uphole Info^ 1 ^Do database math by conventional method (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/elev_stat_math).^) (^Shot Holes Ignoring Upholes Times^ 2 ^Do database math using weathering velocity to compute uphole times (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/noup_stat_math).^) (^Surface Source^ 4 ^Do database math without shot depths and uphole times (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/surf_stat_math).^) (^Other (user-defined)^ 3 ^Do database math using some other method (user-defined stat_math file).^))
:selected_item (^Surface Source^ 4 ^Do database math without shot depths and uphole times (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/surf_stat_math).^)
:value 4
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select the method to use to compute the statics. The different methods have slightly different computation algoriths^
:parameter METHOD1
:text ^Database math method for refraction statics^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Use the default ref_stat_math file^ 1 ^Do database math by conventional method (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/ref_stat_math).^) (^Other (user-defined)^ 2 ^Do database math using some other method (user-defined stat_math file).^))
:selected_item (^Use the default ref_stat_math file^ 1 ^Do database math by conventional method (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/ref_stat_math).^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select the math_file to be used for working with the refraction statics.^
:parameter W_VELOC
:text ^ Specify Weathering velocity^
:type :edit
:type_desc (30 80 5 ^ :FORMAT Groups of 'STATION:Weathering Velocity /' values
 EXAMPLE: 101:3500 / 242:3800 / 440:4400 /
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 3)
:value ^101:3000/201:3500/351:4000/^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Enter groups of STATION-Weathering Velocity values. **SEE EXAMPLE!!!**^
:parameter MATHFILE
:text ^ Database math file for elevation statics^
:type :edit
:type_desc (31 80 5 ^ :Format / 'path' / 'filename' 
 :Example /usr/joepro/elev_stat_method2^)
:value ^/promax_home/port/misc/elev_stat_math^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^This specifies the name of the file that is used for database math to generate elevation statics.^
:parameter MATHFIL1
:text ^Database math file for refraction statics^
:type :edit
:type_desc (31 80 5 ^ :Format / 'path' / 'filename' 
 :Example /usr/johndoe/ref_stat_method2^)
:value ^/promax_home/port/misc/ref_stat_math^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Specify the file name for the appropriate refraction static solution calculation.^
:parameter NMO_METH
:text ^NMO static method^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Elevations^ 1 ^Use the smoothed surface elevations (NMO datum).^) (^Mean Statics^ 2 ^Use the smoothed mean of source and receiver statics of contributing traces in a CDP.^))
:selected_item (^Mean Statics^ 2 ^Use the smoothed mean of source and receiver statics of contributing traces in a CDP.^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^Select the method for creating the NMO statics. See the help file for more explanation.^
:parameter NSMOOTH
:text ^Length of smoother^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 4 1 NIL)
:value 51
:mouse_text ^Enter the length of the smoother (in CDPs). Use an odd number.^
:parameter S_STATIC
:text ^Select SOURCE statics^
:type :action
:type_desc (^SIN GEOMETRY STATDT11^)
:selected_item :none
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a SOURCE Statics file description (SDRM, SDLT, SGRM)from the SIN GEOMETRY database.^
:parameter R_STATIC
:text ^Select RECEIVER statics^
:type :action
:type_desc (^SRF GEOMETRY STATDT11^)
:selected_item :none
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a RECEIVER Statics file description (RDRM, RDLT, RGRM)from the SRF GEOMETRY database.^
:parameter DATUM1
:text ^Processing DATUM^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^NMO DATUM^ 1 ^Compute non-zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to Smooth Surface (N_DATUM)^) (^FINAL DATUM^ 2 ^Compute zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to FINAL DATUM. NMO_DATUM = FINAL DATUM^))
:selected_item (^NMO DATUM^ 1 ^Compute non-zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to Smooth Surface (N_DATUM)^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select datum to which the data will be referenced after running Apply Datum Statics.^
:parameter DB_NUM
:text ^Run ID^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 2)
:value ^11^
:mouse_text ^Enter a 2 characters (number) identifying the database output parameters as S_STATXX, R_STATXX, C_STATXX and N_DATMXX^
)
"

:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Enter groups of STATION-Weathering Velocity values. **SEE EXAMPLE!!!**^
:parameter MATHFILE
:text ^ Database math file for elevation statics^
:type :edit
:type_desc (31 80 5 ^ :Format / 'path' / 'filename' 
 :Example /usr/joepro/elev_stat_method2^)
:value ^/promax_home/port/misc/elev_stat_math^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^This specifies the name of the file that is used for database math to generate elevation statics.^
:parameter MATHFIL1
:text ^Database math file for refraction statics^
:type :edit
:type_desc (31 80 5 ^ :Format / 'path' / 'filename' 
 :Example /usr/johndoe/ref_stat_method2^)
:value ^/promax_home/port/misc/ref_stat_math^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Specify the file name for the appropriate refraction static solution calculation.^
:parameter NMO_METH
:text ^NMO static method^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Elevations^ 1 ^Use the smoothed surface elevations (NMO datum).^) (^Mean Statics^ 2 ^Use the smoothed mean of source and receiver statics of contributing traces in a CDP.^))
:selected_item (^Mean Statics^ 2 ^Use the smoothed mean of source and receiver statics of contributing traces in a CDP.^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^Select the method for creating the NMO statics. See the help file for more explanation.^
:parameter NSMOOTH
:text ^Length of smoother^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 4 1 NIL)
:value 51
:mouse_text ^Enter the length of the smoother (in CDPs). Use an odd number.^
:parameter S_STATIC
:text ^Select SOURCE statics^
:type :action
:type_desc (^SIN GEOMETRY STATDT12^)
:selected_item :none
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a SOURCE Statics file description (SDRM, SDLT, SGRM)from the SIN GEOMETRY database.^
:parameter R_STATIC
:text ^Select RECEIVER statics^
:type :action
:type_desc (^SRF GEOMETRY STATDT12^)
:selected_item :none
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a RECEIVER Statics file description (RDRM, RDLT, RGRM)from the SRF GEOMETRY database.^
:parameter DATUM1
:text ^Processing DATUM^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^NMO DATUM^ 1 ^Compute non-zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to Smooth Surface (N_DATUM)^) (^FINAL DATUM^ 2 ^Compute zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to FINAL DATUM. NMO_DATUM = FINAL DATUM^))
:selected_item (^NMO DATUM^ 1 ^Compute non-zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to Smooth Surface (N_DATUM)^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select datum to which the data will be referenced after running Apply Datum Statics.^
:parameter DB_NUM
:text ^Run ID^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 2)
:value ^12^
:mouse_text ^Enter a 2 characters (number) identifying the database output parameters as S_STATXX, R_STATXX, C_STATXX and N_DATMXX^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Datum Statics Calculation*^
:enablep NIL
:name DATUM_STAT_CALC
:value_tab 35
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE STATTYPE)) RULE1ELEV (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE METHOD)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE METHOD))) (((VALUE STATTYPE)) RULE1REFR (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE METHOD1)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE METHOD1))) (((VALUE STATTYPE) (VALUE METHOD)) RULE2ELEV (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 1) (= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 3)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE MATHFILE)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE MATHFILE))) (((VALUE STATTYPE) (VALUE METHOD1)) RULE2REFR (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 2) (= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD1)) 2)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE MATHFIL1)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE MATHFIL1))) (((VALUE NSMOOTH)) RULE3 (EVENP (VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH))) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH) (+ (VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH)) 1))) (((VALUE STATTYPE) (VALUE METHOD)) RULE4 (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 1) (= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 2)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE W_VELOC)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE W_VELOC))) (((VALUE STATTYPE)) RULE5 (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (S_STATIC R_STATIC))) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE (S_STATIC R_STATIC)))) (((VALUE S_STATIC)) RULE1_CALL_DBPARM (VALUE (QUOTE S_STATIC)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE S_STATIC) NIL) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE S_STATIC) NIL) (SET_TYPE_DESC (QUOTE S_STATIC) (LIST (CHOOSE_OLD_DB_PARM))))) (((VALUE R_STATIC)) RULE1_CALL_DBPARM (VALUE (QUOTE R_STATIC)) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE R_STATIC) NIL) (SET_SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE R_STATIC) NIL) (SET_TYPE_DESC (QUOTE R_STATIC) (LIST (CHOOSE_OLD_DB_PARM))))))
:exec_data (^DATUM_STAT_CALC^ (^SPECIAL^ (^TOOLTYPE^ :implicit ^STAND_ALONE^) (^PATHNAME^ :implicit ^datum_stat_calc.exe^) (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: datum_stat_calc.menu 49485 2013-08-28 04:40:05Z Chris Jones $^) (^MATHFILE^ :implicit (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 1) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/elev_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 2) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/noup_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 4) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/surf_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 3) (VALUE (QUOTE MATHFILE))))) (^STATTYPE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE))) (^METHOD^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD))) (^W_VELOC^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE W_VELOC))) (^FNL_ELEV^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE FNL_ELEV))) (^REPL_VEL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE REPL_VEL))) (^NMO_METH^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE NMO_METH))) (^NSMOOTH^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH))) (^S_STATIC^ :implicit (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE S_STATIC)))) (^R_STATIC^ :implicit (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE R_STATIC)))) (^DATUM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE DATUM1))) (^DB_NUM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE DB_NUM))) (^MATHFIL1^ :implicit (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD1)) 1) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/ref_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD1)) 2) (VALUE (QUOTE MATHFIL1))))))):parameter STATTYPE
:text ^Elevation or Refraction^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Elevation^ 1 ^Compute Elevation statics to final datum.^) (^Refraction^ 2 ^Input Refraction statics to final datum^))
:selected_item (^Refraction^ 2 ^Input Refraction statics to final datum^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^Elevation will compute shot, recv and cdp statics -- Refraction will copy shot and rcvr but compute cdp statics^
:parameter FNL_ELEV
:text ^Final datum elevation^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 16)
:value ^0^
:mouse_text ^Enter final datum elevation constant value or PARAMETER from the SRF GEOMETRY DataBase. See help for other suggestions.^
:parameter REPL_VEL
:text ^Replacement velocity^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 16)
:value ^2000^
:mouse_text ^Enter replacement velocity constant value or PARAMETER from the SRF GEOMETRY DataBase. See help for other suggestions.^
:parameter METHOD
:text ^Database math method for elevation statics^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Shot Holes Using Uphole Info^ 1 ^Do database math by conventional method (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/elev_stat_math).^) (^Shot Holes Ignoring Upholes Times^ 2 ^Do database math using weathering velocity to compute uphole times (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/noup_stat_math).^) (^Surface Source^ 4 ^Do database math without shot depths and uphole times (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/surf_stat_math).^) (^Other (user-defined)^ 3 ^Do database math using some other method (user-defined stat_math file).^))
:selected_item (^Surface Source^ 4 ^Do database math without shot depths and uphole times (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/surf_stat_math).^)
:value 4
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select the method to use to compute the statics. The different methods have slightly different computation algoriths^
:parameter METHOD1
:text ^Database math method for refraction statics^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Use the default ref_stat_math file^ 1 ^Do database math by conventional method (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/ref_stat_math).^) (^Other (user-defined)^ 2 ^Do database math using some other method (user-defined stat_math file).^))
:selected_item (^Use the default ref_stat_math file^ 1 ^Do database math by conventional method (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/ref_stat_math).^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select the math_file to be used for working with the refraction statics.^
:parameter W_VELOC
:text ^ Specify Weathering velocity^
:type :edit
:type_desc (30 80 5 ^ :FORMAT Groups of 'STATION:Weathering Velocity /' values
 EXAMPLE: 101:3500 / 242:3800 / 440:4400 /
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 3)
:value ^101:3000/201:3500/351:4000/^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Enter groups of STATION-Weathering Velocity values. **SEE EXAMPLE!!!**^
:parameter MATHFILE
:text ^ Database math file for elevation statics^
:type :edit
:type_desc (31 80 5 ^ :Format / 'path' / 'filename' 
 :Example /usr/joepro/elev_stat_method2^)
:value ^/promax_home/port/misc/elev_stat_math^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^This specifies the name of the file that is used for database math to generate elevation statics.^
:parameter MATHFIL1
:text ^Database math file for refraction statics^
:type :edit
:type_desc (31 80 5 ^ :Format / 'path' / 'filename' 
 :Example /usr/johndoe/ref_stat_method2^)
:value ^/promax_home/port/misc/ref_stat_math^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Specify the file name for the appropriate refraction static solution calculation.^
:parameter NMO_METH
:text ^NMO static method^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Elevations^ 1 ^Use the smoothed surface elevations (NMO datum).^) (^Mean Statics^ 2 ^Use the smoothed mean of source and receiver statics of contributing traces in a CDP.^))
:selected_item (^Mean Statics^ 2 ^Use the smoothed mean of source and receiver statics of contributing traces in a CDP.^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^Select the method for creating the NMO statics. See the help file for more explanation.^
:parameter NSMOOTH
:text ^Length of smoother^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 4 1 NIL)
:value 51
:mouse_text ^Enter the length of the smoother (in CDPs). Use an odd number.^
:parameter S_STATIC
:text ^Select SOURCE statics^
:type :action
:type_desc (^SIN GEOMETRY STATDT13^)
:selected_item :none
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a SOURCE Statics file description (SDRM, SDLT, SGRM)from the SIN GEOMETRY database.^
:parameter R_STATIC
:text ^Select RECEIVER statics^
:type :action
:type_desc (^SRF GEOMETRY STATDT13^)
:selected_item :none
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a RECEIVER Statics file description (RDRM, RDLT, RGRM)from the SRF GEOMETRY database.^
:parameter DATUM1
:text ^Processing DATUM^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^NMO DATUM^ 1 ^Compute non-zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to Smooth Surface (N_DATUM)^) (^FINAL DATUM^ 2 ^Compute zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to FINAL DATUM. NMO_DATUM = FINAL DATUM^))
:selected_item (^NMO DATUM^ 1 ^Compute non-zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to Smooth Surface (N_DATUM)^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select datum to which the data will be referenced after running Apply Datum Statics.^
:parameter DB_NUM
:text ^Run ID^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 2)
:value ^13^
:mouse_text ^Enter a 2 characters (number) identifying the database output parameters as S_STATXX, R_STATXX, C_STATXX and N_DATMXX^
)
"

:exec_data (^DATUM_STAT_CALC^ (^SPECIAL^ (^TOOLTYPE^ :implicit ^STAND_ALONE^) (^PATHNAME^ :implicit ^datum_stat_calc.exe^) (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: datum_stat_calc.menu 49485 2013-08-28 04:40:05Z Chris Jones $^) (^MATHFILE^ :implicit (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 1) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/elev_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 2) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/noup_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 4) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/surf_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD)) 3) (VALUE (QUOTE MATHFILE))))) (^STATTYPE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE STATTYPE))) (^METHOD^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD))) (^W_VELOC^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE W_VELOC))) (^FNL_ELEV^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE FNL_ELEV))) (^REPL_VEL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE REPL_VEL))) (^NMO_METH^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE NMO_METH))) (^NSMOOTH^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE NSMOOTH))) (^S_STATIC^ :implicit (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE S_STATIC)))) (^R_STATIC^ :implicit (FIRST (TYPE_DESC (QUOTE R_STATIC)))) (^DATUM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE DATUM1))) (^DB_NUM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE DB_NUM))) (^MATHFIL1^ :implicit (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD1)) 1) (PROMAX_PATH ^port/misc/ref_stat_math^)) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE METHOD1)) 2) (VALUE (QUOTE MATHFIL1))))))):parameter STATTYPE
:text ^Elevation or Refraction^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Elevation^ 1 ^Compute Elevation statics to final datum.^) (^Refraction^ 2 ^Input Refraction statics to final datum^))
:selected_item (^Refraction^ 2 ^Input Refraction statics to final datum^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^Elevation will compute shot, recv and cdp statics -- Refraction will copy shot and rcvr but compute cdp statics^
:parameter FNL_ELEV
:text ^Final datum elevation^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 16)
:value ^0^
:mouse_text ^Enter final datum elevation constant value or PARAMETER from the SRF GEOMETRY DataBase. See help for other suggestions.^
:parameter REPL_VEL
:text ^Replacement velocity^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 16)
:value ^2000^
:mouse_text ^Enter replacement velocity constant value or PARAMETER from the SRF GEOMETRY DataBase. See help for other suggestions.^
:parameter METHOD
:text ^Database math method for elevation statics^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Shot Holes Using Uphole Info^ 1 ^Do database math by conventional method (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/elev_stat_math).^) (^Shot Holes Ignoring Upholes Times^ 2 ^Do database math using weathering velocity to compute uphole times (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/noup_stat_math).^) (^Surface Source^ 4 ^Do database math without shot depths and uphole times (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/surf_stat_math).^) (^Other (user-defined)^ 3 ^Do database math using some other method (user-defined stat_math file).^))
:selected_item (^Surface Source^ 4 ^Do database math without shot depths and uphole times (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/surf_stat_math).^)
:value 4
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select the method to use to compute the statics. The different methods have slightly different computation algoriths^
:parameter METHOD1
:text ^Database math method for refraction statics^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Use the default ref_stat_math file^ 1 ^Do database math by conventional method (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/ref_stat_math).^) (^Other (user-defined)^ 2 ^Do database math using some other method (user-defined stat_math file).^))
:selected_item (^Use the default ref_stat_math file^ 1 ^Do database math by conventional method (see file $PROMAX_HOME/port/misc/ref_stat_math).^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select the math_file to be used for working with the refraction statics.^
:parameter W_VELOC
:text ^ Specify Weathering velocity^
:type :edit
:type_desc (30 80 5 ^ :FORMAT Groups of 'STATION:Weathering Velocity /' values
 EXAMPLE: 101:3500 / 242:3800 / 440:4400 /
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 3)
:value ^101:3000/201:3500/351:4000/^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Enter groups of STATION-Weathering Velocity values. **SEE EXAMPLE!!!**^
:parameter MATHFILE
:text ^ Database math file for elevation statics^
:type :edit
:type_desc (31 80 5 ^ :Format / 'path' / 'filename' 
 :Example /usr/joepro/elev_stat_method2^)
:value ^/promax_home/port/misc/elev_stat_math^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^This specifies the name of the file that is used for database math to generate elevation statics.^
:parameter MATHFIL1
:text ^Database math file for refraction statics^
:type :edit
:type_desc (31 80 5 ^ :Format / 'path' / 'filename' 
 :Example /usr/johndoe/ref_stat_method2^)
:value ^/promax_home/port/misc/ref_stat_math^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Specify the file name for the appropriate refraction static solution calculation.^
:parameter NMO_METH
:text ^NMO static method^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Elevations^ 1 ^Use the smoothed surface elevations (NMO datum).^) (^Mean Statics^ 2 ^Use the smoothed mean of source and receiver statics of contributing traces in a CDP.^))
:selected_item (^Mean Statics^ 2 ^Use the smoothed mean of source and receiver statics of contributing traces in a CDP.^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^Select the method for creating the NMO statics. See the help file for more explanation.^
:parameter NSMOOTH
:text ^Length of smoother^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 4 1 NIL)
:value 51
:mouse_text ^Enter the length of the smoother (in CDPs). Use an odd number.^
:parameter S_STATIC
:text ^Select SOURCE statics^
:type :action
:type_desc (^SIN GEOMETRY STATVN32^)
:selected_item :none
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a SOURCE Statics file description (SDRM, SDLT, SGRM)from the SIN GEOMETRY database.^
:parameter R_STATIC
:text ^Select RECEIVER statics^
:type :action
:type_desc (^SRF GEOMETRY STATVN32^)
:selected_item :none
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a RECEIVER Statics file description (RDRM, RDLT, RGRM)from the SRF GEOMETRY database.^
:parameter DATUM1
:text ^Processing DATUM^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^NMO DATUM^ 1 ^Compute non-zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to Smooth Surface (N_DATUM)^) (^FINAL DATUM^ 2 ^Compute zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to FINAL DATUM. NMO_DATUM = FINAL DATUM^))
:selected_item (^NMO DATUM^ 1 ^Compute non-zero cdp mean (C_STATIC)- when statics are applied, the data will be referenced to Smooth Surface (N_DATUM)^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select datum to which the data will be referenced after running Apply Datum Statics.^
:parameter DB_NUM
:text ^Run ID^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 2)
:value ^32^
:mouse_text ^Enter a 2 characters (number) identifying the database output parameters as S_STATXX, R_STATXX, C_STATXX and N_DATMXX^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Filter Application^
:enablep T
:name WP_APPLY
:value_tab 45
:plot_label T
:rules NIL
:exec_data (^WP_APPLY^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: wp_apply.menu 44577 2009-07-29 16:44:43Z David Johnston $ $Revision: 44577 $ $Date: 2009-07-29 11:44:43 -0500 (Wed, 29 Jul 2009) $^) (^CAPPLYOP^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CAPPLYOP))) (^CLABEL ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CLABEL))) (^IREMUTE ^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IREMUTE)) 1 0)) (^ISUM_OPT^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE ISUM_OPT)) 1 0)) (^TZEROIN ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE TZEROIN))))):parameter CAPPLYOP
:text ^Application option^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Convolution^ ^CONV^ ^Convolve with input filter.^) (^Correlation^ ^CORR^ ^Correlate with input filter.^))
:selected_item (^Convolution^ ^CONV^ ^Convolve with input filter.^)
:value ^CONV^
:mouse_text ^Choose filter application mode.^
:parameter IREMUTE
:text ^Re-apply trace mute after filter?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^Trace mutes (such as first break suppression mutes) may be re-applied after filtering.^
:parameter ISUM_OPT
:text ^Average multiple filters?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^If 'YES', multiple filters in dataset will be averaged, if 'NO', they will be applied sequentially.^
:parameter TZEROIN
:text ^Time on input filter representing time zero^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 7 0.0 NIL)
:value 0.0
:mouse_text ^What time on the input filter represents time zero? If a valid header already exists, it will be used.^
:parameter CLABEL
:text ^SELECT filter dataset^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc (DATASET_LIST DATASETS)
:selected_item ^99.00 kita min phase filter^
:value ^61619376^
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a dataset from the DATASETS menu.^
:properties (:supported_formats (^PROMAX^ ^PROMAX_SMART^ ^PROMAX_TAPE^)
 )
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^True Amplitude Recovery^
:enablep T
:name TAR
:value_tab 45
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE APPLY_DB)) RULE1 (VALUE (QUOTE APPLY_DB)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (TAR_REF DB_PER_S))) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE (TAR_REF DB_PER_S)))) (((VALUE APPLY_IE)) RULE2 (VALUE (QUOTE APPLY_IE)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE INLS_ATN)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE INLS_ATN))) (((VALUE APPLY_SD)) RULE3 (VALUE (QUOTE APPLY_SD)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE SDV_TYPE)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE SDV_TYPE))) (((VALUE APPLY_IE) (VALUE APPLY_SD)) RULE4 (OR (VALUE (QUOTE APPLY_IE)) (VALUE (QUOTE APPLY_SD))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (DB_BOOL VELVARYS))) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE (DB_BOOL VELVARYS)))) (((VALUE APPLY_PW)) RULE5 (VALUE (QUOTE APPLY_PW)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE T_POWER)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE T_POWER))) (((VALUE TAR_VEL)) VEL_DEFAULT_RULE1 (AND (EQUAL (VALUE (QUOTE TAR_VEL)) ^XXX^) (= (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^IUNITSz^) 1)) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE TAR_VEL) ^0-5000,1000-7500,2000-9500,3000-11500,4000-14000,6000-18000,8000-22000/^)) (((VALUE TAR_VEL)) VEL_DEFAULT_RULE2 (EQUAL (VALUE (QUOTE TAR_VEL)) ^XXX^) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE TAR_VEL) ^0-1480,1000-2500,2000-3200,3000-4000,4000-4500,6000-6000,8000-7000/^)) (((VALUE TAR_VEL2)) VEL2_DEFAULT_RULE1 (AND (EQUAL (VALUE (QUOTE TAR_VEL2)) ^XXX^) (= (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^IUNITSz^) 1)) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE TAR_VEL2) ^1:0-5000,1000-7500,2000-9500,3000-11500,4000-14000,6000-18000,8000-22000/^)) (((VALUE TAR_VEL2)) VEL2_DEFAULT_RULE2 (EQUAL (VALUE (QUOTE TAR_VEL2)) ^XXX^) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE TAR_VEL2) ^1:0-1480,1000-2500,2000-3200,3000-4000,4000-4500,6000-6000,8000-7000/^)) (((VALUE DB_BOOL) (SHOWP DB_BOOL)) DB_BOOL_SHOW_1 (AND (VALUE (QUOTE DB_BOOL)) (SHOWING (QUOTE DB_BOOL))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE DB_VEL)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE DB_VEL))) (((VALUE DB_BOOL) (SHOWP DB_BOOL) (VALUE VELVARYS) (SHOWP VELVARYS)) TAR_VEL_SHOW (AND (NOT (VALUE (QUOTE DB_BOOL))) (SHOWING (QUOTE DB_BOOL)) (NOT (VALUE (QUOTE VELVARYS))) (SHOWING (QUOTE VELVARYS))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE TAR_VEL)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE TAR_VEL))) (((VALUE DB_BOOL) (SHOWP DB_BOOL) (VALUE VELVARYS) (SHOWP VELVARYS)) TAR_VEL2_SHOW (AND (NOT (VALUE (QUOTE DB_BOOL))) (SHOWING (QUOTE DB_BOOL)) (VALUE (QUOTE VELVARYS)) (SHOWING (QUOTE VELVARYS))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE TAR_VEL2)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE TAR_VEL2))) (((VALUE NORM_SRC)) NORM_RULE1 (= (VALUE (QUOTE NORM_SRC)) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE REF_TIME)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE REF_TIME))) (((VALUE NORM_SRC)) NORM_RULE1 (= (VALUE (QUOTE NORM_SRC)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE TAR_NORM)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE TAR_NORM))))
:exec_data (^TAR^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: tar.menu 44577 2009-07-29 16:44:43Z David Johnston $ $Revision: 44577 $ $Date: 2009-07-29 11:44:43 -0500 (Wed, 29 Jul 2009) $^) (^NUM_WAYS^ :implicit 2) (^VELVARYS^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE VELVARYS)) 1 0)) (^TAR_VEL ^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE VELVARYS)) (VALUE (QUOTE TAR_VEL2)) (VALUE (QUOTE TAR_VEL)))) (^TAR_REF ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE TAR_REF))) (^APPLY_SD^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE APPLY_SD)) 1 0)) (^APPLY_IE^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE APPLY_IE)) 1 0)) (^APPLY_DB^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE APPLY_DB)) 1 0)) (^APPLY_PW^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE APPLY_PW)) 1 0)) (^DB_PER_S^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE DB_PER_S))) (^INLS_ATN^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE INLS_ATN))) (^SDV_TYPE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE SDV_TYPE))) (^TAR_MODE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE TAR_MODE))) (^DB_VEL ^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE DB_BOOL)) (VALUE (QUOTE DB_VEL)) ^NONE ^)) (^T_POWER ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE T_POWER))) (^TIME_MAX^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE TIME_MAX))) (^NORM_SRC^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE NORM_SRC))) (^REF_TIME^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE REF_TIME))) (^TAR_NORM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE TAR_NORM))))):parameter APPLY_SD
:text ^Apply spherical divergence corrections?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' to compute corrections to compensate for loss of amplitudes due to spherical wavefront spreading.^
:parameter SDV_TYPE
:text ^ Basis for spherical spreading^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^1/dist ^ 1 ^Corrections based on the reciprocal of the distance that the wavefront has travelled.^) (^1/(time*vel**2)^ 2 ^Corrections based on a function of travel time and velocity (assuming a layered earth).^))
:selected_item (^1/(time*vel**2)^ 2 ^Corrections based on a function of travel time and velocity (assuming a layered earth).^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^Select between the 2 choices for spherical spreading corrections. (See P. Newman, Geophysics v. 38-03, p. 481.)^
:parameter APPLY_IE
:text ^Apply inelastic attenuation corrections?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' to compute corrections to compensate for loss of amplitudes due to inelastic attenuation.^
:parameter INLS_ATN
:text ^ Inelastic attenuation correction constant^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 8 1.0E-6 0.01)
:value 2.0E-4
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Constant inelastic attenuation value (alpha) used in: e**(alpha*x), where x = velocity * time.^
:parameter DB_BOOL
:text ^Get TAR velocity function from database?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^A velocity function can either be retrieved from the database or specified by hand.^
:parameter VELVARYS
:text ^ Are velocities spatially variant?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Velocities may be spatially variant by CDP, but this will cause a longer run time.^
:parameter DB_VEL
:text ^ Select velocity parameter file^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc ((PARM_LIST ^VEL^) PARMS)
:selected_item ^terrex_field_1D^
:value ^79991180^
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select an RMS velocity function parameter file from the parameter file menu.^
:properties (:supported_formats ^PROMAX^
 )
:parameter TAR_VEL
:text ^ Specify TAR velocity function^
:plot_label T
:type :edit
:type_desc (31 80 5 ^ FORMAT: T1-V1,T2-V2,T3-V3,...,Tn-Vn
 EXAMPLE: 0-5000,1000-7500,2000-9500,3000-11500,4000-14000,6000-18000/
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 3)
:value ^0-1480,1000-2500,2000-3200,3000-4000,4000-4500,6000-6000,8000-7000/^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to define the AVERAGE velocity function for true amplitude corrections (2-way time[in ms]-vel, time-vel, etc).^
:parameter TAR_VEL2
:text ^ Specify TAR velocity functions^
:plot_label T
:type :edit
:type_desc (31 80 5 ^ FORMAT: CDP1:T1-V1,...,Tn-Vn/CDP2:T1-V1,...,Tn-Vn/.../
 EXAMPLE: 1:0-5000,1000-7500,2000-9500,3000-11500,4000-14000,6000-18000/
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 3)
:value ^1:0-1480,1000-2500,2000-3200,3000-4000,4000-4500,6000-6000,8000-7000/^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to define the velocity functions for true amplitude corrections (2-way time[in ms]-vel, time-vel, etc).^
:parameter APPLY_DB
:text ^Apply dB/sec corrections?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Compute corrections by a simple deciBels per second amplitude adjustment function.^
:parameter TAR_REF
:text ^ dB/sec correction start time^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Time zero^ 0 ^dB/sec correction starts at time zero.^) (^Water bottom^ 1 ^dB/sec correction starts at the water-bottom time.^))
:selected_item (^Time zero^ 0 ^dB/sec correction starts at time zero.^)
:value 0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select dB/sec correction start time.^
:parameter DB_PER_S
:text ^ dB/sec correction constant^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 6 -120.0 NIL)
:value 6.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^This is the constant dB/sec value used to compute amplitude corrections.^
:parameter APPLY_PW
:text ^Apply time raised to a power corrections?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Compute corrections by raising the time to a power and multiplying it by the sample value.^
:parameter T_POWER
:text ^ Time-Power constant^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 6 -10.0 NIL)
:value 2.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^This is the constant to raise time to before multiplying by the trace samples.^
:parameter TAR_MODE
:text ^APPLY or REMOVE amplitude corrections?^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Apply^ 1 ^This is the normal mode wherein seismic data are corrected for loss of signal strength.^) (^Remove^ 2 ^This mode can be used to introduce Earth amplitude effects to synthetic data.^))
:selected_item (^Apply^ 1 ^This is the normal mode wherein seismic data are corrected for loss of signal strength.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Normally, gain is APPLIED, but for synthetic data you may wish to REMOVE amplitude effects.^
:parameter TIME_MAX
:text ^Maximum application TIME^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 6 0.0 NIL)
:value 0.0
:mouse_text ^Maximum time in ms for computing TAR corrections. Beyond this time a constant scalar is applied. Use 0.0 for whole trace.^
:parameter NORM_SRC
:text ^Normalization source^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Calculate^ 1 ^Calculate normalization constant from menu parameters.^) (^Menu^ 2 ^Get normalization constant from menu.^) (^Header^ 3 ^Get normalization constant from trace header entry TAR_NORM.^))
:selected_item (^Calculate^ 1 ^Calculate normalization constant from menu parameters.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Computed gain curves are divided by normalization constant so that trace amplitudes are relatively unchanged.^
:parameter REF_TIME
:text ^Normalization reference TIME^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 6 0.0 NIL)
:value 0.0
:mouse_text ^Reference time in ms for normalizing TAR corrections. Must not exceed length of trace. 0.0 defaults to middle of trace.^
:parameter TAR_NORM
:text ^Normalization constant^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 14 1.2E-38 NIL)
:value 1.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Enter normalization constant. Must be > 0.^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Gated SC Decon 3: Application^
:enablep T
:name SCDECONM3

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Trace Header Math^
:enablep NIL
:name THDRMATH
:value_tab 60
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE MODE)) MODE1 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE OPERATE)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE OPERATE))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE2 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (IENSTRC CHEADNAM STARTVAL INC_VAL IRESET))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (IENSTRC CHEADNAM STARTVAL INC_VAL IRESET)))) (((VALUE MODE) (VALUE IRESET)) MODE2A (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (VALUE (QUOTE IRESET))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE CHDRESET)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE CHDRESET))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE3 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 3) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (ANGLE XSHIFT YSHIFT))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (ANGLE XSHIFT YSHIFT)))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE4 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 4) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (WARNING IVALID IGEOM IDTYP IDOMAIN ISORT))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (WARNING IVALID IGEOM IDTYP IDOMAIN ISORT)))))
:exec_data (EVAL (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 1) (QUOTE (^THDRMATH^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^:ProMAX $Id thdrmath.menu 46125 2010-11-30 01:11:19Z Gary :Wong $ $Revision :46125 $ $Date 2010-11-29 18:11:19 -0700 (Mon, 29 Nov 2010) $^) (^OPERATE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE OPERATE))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (QUOTE (^HEADER_RENUM^ (^GENERAL^ (^IENSTRC^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IENSTRC))) (^CHEADNAM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADNAM))) (^STARTVAL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE STARTVAL))) (^INC_VAL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE INC_VAL))) (^IRESET^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IRESET)) 1 0)) (^CHDRESET^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHDRESET))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 3) (QUOTE (^ROTATE^ (^GENERAL^ (^ANGLE ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ANGLE))) (^XSHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE XSHIFT))) (^YSHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE YSHIFT))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 4) (QUOTE (^DEITY^ (^GENERAL^ (^IVALID ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IVALID))) (^IGEOM ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IGEOM))) (^IDOMAIN^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IDOMAIN))) (^IDTYP ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IDTYP))) (^ISORT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ISORT))))))))):parameter MODE
:text ^Select mode^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Fixed equation mode^ 1 ^Define a fixed equation. (DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CHANGE THE FORMAT OF EXISTING PROMAX HEADER WORDS; e.g. CHAN=1.0)^) (^Sequence renumber mode^ 2 ^Renumber sequences.^) (^Rotation & Translation^ 3 ^Coordinate translation and rotation.^) (^Change data attributes^ 4 ^Change global data parameters.^))
:selected_item (^Fixed equation mode^ 1 ^Define a fixed equation. (DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CHANGE THE FORMAT OF EXISTING PROMAX HEADER WORDS; e.g. CHAN=1.0)^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select the math mode.^
:parameter OPERATE
:text ^ DEFINE trace header equation(s)^
:plot_label T
:type :edit
:type_desc (25 NIL 5 ^ :FORMAT C=A+B-C; C=NINT(A/B)+MOD(A,B); C=A*((B**2.0)/C+1.0)
 (Use semicolons to separate equations; See Help '?')

 EXAMPLES: NEW_ELEV = REC_ELEV + 100.0; SOU_SLOC = NINT(SOU_X) / 55
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 5)
:value ^offsetx=abs(sou_sloc-r_line)*12.5;
offsety=abs(srf_sloc-s_line)*25;^
