:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Set the global runtime flag for valid database. (i.e. trace numbers are unique and match the database)^
:parameter IGEOM
:text ^ Geometry valid?^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^Valid ^ 1 ^Geometry loaded in the trace header match the database.^) (^Invalid ^ 0 ^Geometry loaded in the trace header do NOT match the database.^))
:selected_item (^No change^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Set the global runtime flag for valid geometry. (i.e. geometry in the trace headers matches the database)^
:parameter IDOMAIN
:text ^ Domain of data^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^T-X ^ 0 ^Normal time-space domain.^) (^F-X ^ 1 ^Frequency-space domain.^) (^F-T ^ 2 ^Frequency-time domain.^) (^F-K ^ 3 ^Frequency-wavenumber domain.^) (^Tau-P ^ 4 ^Tau-P (time-ray-parameter) domain.^) (^Depth ^ 7 ^Depth-space domain.^))
:selected_item (^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select new data type.^
:parameter IDTYP
:text ^ Data type^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^Normal unstacked ^ 0 ^Normal unstacked data.^) (^Normal stacked ^ 7 ^Normal stacked data.^) (^Unstacked trasformed^ 2 ^Transformed unstacked - e.g., frequency dom. - data^) (^Stacked transformed ^ 3 ^Transformed stacked - e.g., frequency domain - data^))
:selected_item (^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select data type.^
:parameter ISORT
:text ^ Primary sort of data^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^CDP Sort ^ 1 ^CDP bin number sorted data.^) (^SIN Sort ^ 2 ^Shot index number sorted data.^) (^RECSLOC Sort^ 3 ^Receiver surface station sorted data.^) (^Offset Sort ^ 4 ^Shot to receiver signed offset sorted data.^) (^CHAN Sort ^ 5 ^Channel number sorted data.^) (^ILINE Sort ^ 7 ^Inline number sorted data.^) (^XLINE Sort ^ 8 ^Crossline number sorted data.^))
:selected_item (^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select new primary sort order.^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Trace Header Math^
:enablep NIL
:name THDRMATH
:value_tab 60
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE MODE)) MODE1 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE OPERATE)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE OPERATE))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE2 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (IENSTRC CHEADNAM STARTVAL INC_VAL IRESET))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (IENSTRC CHEADNAM STARTVAL INC_VAL IRESET)))) (((VALUE MODE) (VALUE IRESET)) MODE2A (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (VALUE (QUOTE IRESET))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE CHDRESET)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE CHDRESET))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE3 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 3) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (ANGLE XSHIFT YSHIFT))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (ANGLE XSHIFT YSHIFT)))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE4 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 4) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (WARNING IVALID IGEOM IDTYP IDOMAIN ISORT))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (WARNING IVALID IGEOM IDTYP IDOMAIN ISORT)))))
:exec_data (EVAL (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 1) (QUOTE (^THDRMATH^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^:ProMAX $Id thdrmath.menu 46125 2010-11-30 01:11:19Z Gary :Wong $ $Revision :46125 $ $Date 2010-11-29 18:11:19 -0700 (Mon, 29 Nov 2010) $^) (^OPERATE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE OPERATE))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (QUOTE (^HEADER_RENUM^ (^GENERAL^ (^IENSTRC^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IENSTRC))) (^CHEADNAM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADNAM))) (^STARTVAL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE STARTVAL))) (^INC_VAL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE INC_VAL))) (^IRESET^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IRESET)) 1 0)) (^CHDRESET^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHDRESET))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 3) (QUOTE (^ROTATE^ (^GENERAL^ (^ANGLE ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ANGLE))) (^XSHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE XSHIFT))) (^YSHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE YSHIFT))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 4) (QUOTE (^DEITY^ (^GENERAL^ (^IVALID ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IVALID))) (^IGEOM ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IGEOM))) (^IDOMAIN^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IDOMAIN))) (^IDTYP ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IDTYP))) (^ISORT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ISORT))))))))):parameter MODE
:text ^Select mode^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Fixed equation mode^ 1 ^Define a fixed equation. (DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CHANGE THE FORMAT OF EXISTING PROMAX HEADER WORDS; e.g. CHAN=1.0)^) (^Sequence renumber mode^ 2 ^Renumber sequences.^) (^Rotation & Translation^ 3 ^Coordinate translation and rotation.^) (^Change data attributes^ 4 ^Change global data parameters.^))
:selected_item (^Fixed equation mode^ 1 ^Define a fixed equation. (DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CHANGE THE FORMAT OF EXISTING PROMAX HEADER WORDS; e.g. CHAN=1.0)^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select the math mode.^
:parameter OPERATE
:text ^ DEFINE trace header equation(s)^
:plot_label T
:type :edit
:type_desc (25 NIL 5 ^ :FORMAT C=A+B-C; C=NINT(A/B)+MOD(A,B); C=A*((B**2.0)/C+1.0)
 (Use semicolons to separate equations; See Help '?')

 EXAMPLES: NEW_ELEV = REC_ELEV + 100.0; SOU_SLOC = NINT(SOU_X) / 55
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 5)
:value ^sou_y=sou_y-6000000;
rec_y=rec_y-6000000;^
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to access the text editor and define equations to overwrite old header words or create new ones.^
:parameter IENSTRC
:text ^ Renumber ensembles or traces?^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^ENSEMBLES^ 1 ^Renumber ensembles in the order in which they are input.^) (^TRACES ^ 2 ^Renumber headers of traces within ensembles, renumbering starts at the begining of each ensemble.^))
:selected_item (^ENSEMBLES^ 1 ^Renumber ensembles in the order in which they are input.^)
:value 1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^You can renumber either the ensemble number or the traces within ensembles.^
:parameter CHEADNAM
:text ^ SELECT trace header word^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc (HEADER_LIST HEADERS)
:selected_item ^REPEATED data copy number^
:value ^REPEAT ^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select a header word from the headers menu as the HEADER NAME key for renumbering.^
:parameter STARTVAL
:text ^ Starting value^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 12)
:value ^no default^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Value to assign to first trace header encountered, entry for floating point trace headers MUST include a decimal.^
:parameter INC_VAL
:text ^ Increment value^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 12)
:value ^no default^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Value by which to increment successive headers, entry for floating point header values MUST include a decimal.^
:parameter IRESET
:text ^ Reset the Starting value at header change?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^ Do you want to reset the renumber counter to the Starting value when a different trace header changes value?^
:parameter CHDRESET
:text ^ SELECT reset renumber trace header word^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc (HEADER_LIST HEADERS)
:selected_item ^Swath or sail line number^
:value ^S_LINE ^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select a header word from the headers menu as the HEADER NAME key for resetting.^
:parameter ANGLE
:text ^ Rotation angle^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 8 0.0 360.0)
:value 0.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Clockwise rotation angle of new coordinate relative to the original axes. (0.0 - 360.0 degrees)^
:parameter XSHIFT
:text ^ X coordinate shift^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 8 NIL NIL)
:value 0.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Value of X coordinate in old system of the new, translated origin. (0.0 = no shift in X position)^
:parameter YSHIFT
:text ^ Y coordinate shift^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 8 NIL NIL)
:value 0.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Value of Y coordinate in the old system of the new, translated origin. (0.0 = no shift in Y position)^
:parameter WARNING
:text ^** CHANGE THESE ONLY IF YOU UNDERSTAND THE CONSEQUENCES **^
:showp NIL
:parameter IVALID
:text ^ Trace number valid?^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^Valid ^ 1 ^Trace numbers are valid and can be used to reference the database.^) (^Invalid ^ 0 ^Trace numbers are NOT valid and can not be used to reference the database.^))
:selected_item (^No change^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Set the global runtime flag for valid database. (i.e. trace numbers are unique and match the database)^
:parameter IGEOM
:text ^ Geometry valid?^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^Valid ^ 1 ^Geometry loaded in the trace header match the database.^) (^Invalid ^ 0 ^Geometry loaded in the trace header do NOT match the database.^))
:selected_item (^No change^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Set the global runtime flag for valid geometry. (i.e. geometry in the trace headers matches the database)^
:parameter IDOMAIN
:text ^ Domain of data^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^T-X ^ 0 ^Normal time-space domain.^) (^F-X ^ 1 ^Frequency-space domain.^) (^F-T ^ 2 ^Frequency-time domain.^) (^F-K ^ 3 ^Frequency-wavenumber domain.^) (^Tau-P ^ 4 ^Tau-P (time-ray-parameter) domain.^) (^Depth ^ 7 ^Depth-space domain.^))
:selected_item (^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select new data type.^
:parameter IDTYP
:text ^ Data type^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^Normal unstacked ^ 0 ^Normal unstacked data.^) (^Normal stacked ^ 7 ^Normal stacked data.^) (^Unstacked trasformed^ 2 ^Transformed unstacked - e.g., frequency dom. - data^) (^Stacked transformed ^ 3 ^Transformed stacked - e.g., frequency domain - data^))
:selected_item (^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select data type.^
:parameter ISORT
:text ^ Primary sort of data^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^CDP Sort ^ 1 ^CDP bin number sorted data.^) (^SIN Sort ^ 2 ^Shot index number sorted data.^) (^RECSLOC Sort^ 3 ^Receiver surface station sorted data.^) (^Offset Sort ^ 4 ^Shot to receiver signed offset sorted data.^) (^CHAN Sort ^ 5 ^Channel number sorted data.^) (^ILINE Sort ^ 7 ^Inline number sorted data.^) (^XLINE Sort ^ 8 ^Crossline number sorted data.^))
:selected_item (^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select new primary sort order.^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Extract Database Files^
:enablep NIL
:name OPF_EXTRACT
:value_tab 54
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE MARINE)) SHOWSRF (= (VALUE (QUOTE MARINE)) 0) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE SRFMAP)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE SRFMAP))) (((VALUE MARINE)) SHOWCALC_CMP (= (VALUE (QUOTE MARINE)) 1) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE CALC_CMP)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE CALC_CMP))) (((VALUE OVERWRIT)) SHOWPRELOAD (= (VALUE (QUOTE OVERWRIT)) 1) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE PRELOAD)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE PRELOAD))) (((VALUE CDPS) (VALUE OVERWRIT)) SHOWMINCDP (AND (VALUE (QUOTE CDPS)) (= (VALUE (QUOTE OVERWRIT)) 1)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE MINCDP)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE MINCDP))))
:exec_data ((^OPF_EXTRACT^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: opf_extract.menu 44577 2009-07-29 16:44:43Z David Johnston $ $Revision: 44577 $ $Date: 2009-07-29 11:44:43 -0500 (Wed, 29 Jul 2009) $^) (^I3D^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE I3D)) 1 0)) (^MARINE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE MARINE))) (^SINMAP^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE SINMAP))) (^PRELOAD^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE PRELOAD)) 1 0)) (^SRFMAP^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE SRFMAP))) (^OVERWRIT^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE OVERWRIT))) (^PRE_GEOM^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE PRE_GEOM)) 1 0)) (^CDPS^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE CDPS)) 1 0)) (^MINCDP^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE MINCDP))) (^OFBS^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE OFBS)) 1 0)))) ((IF (AND (SHOWING (QUOTE CALC_CMP)) (VALUE (QUOTE CALC_CMP))) ^THDRMATH^ ^VOID^) (^GENERAL^ (^OPERATE^ :implicit ^CMP_X=(SOU_X+REC_X)/2.0^))) ((IF (AND (SHOWING (QUOTE CALC_CMP)) (VALUE (QUOTE CALC_CMP))) ^THDRMATH^ ^VOID^) (^GENERAL^ (^OPERATE^ :implicit ^CMP_Y=(SOU_Y+REC_Y)/2.0^))) ((IF (AND (SHOWING (QUOTE CALC_CMP)) (VALUE (QUOTE CALC_CMP))) ^DB_HDR_LOAD^ ^VOID^) (^GENERAL^ (^DIRECT^ :implicit 1) (^NUMPARMS^ :implicit 2) (^DB_PARM1^ :implicit (STRING_CONCATINATE ^TRC GEOMETRY CDP_X^)) (^DB_PARM2^ :implicit (STRING_CONCATINATE ^TRC GEOMETRY CDP_Y^)) (^HDR_VAL1^ :implicit ^CMP_X ^) (^HDR_VAL2^ :implicit ^CMP_Y ^)))):parameter I3D
:text ^Is this a 3D survey?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^Select Yes, if this is a 3D survey.^
:parameter MARINE
:text ^Data type^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^LAND ^ 0 ^Land data acquisition^) (^MARINE ^ 1 ^Marine data acquisition^))
:selected_item (^LAND ^ 0 ^Land data acquisition^)
:value 0
:mouse_text ^Choose either land or marine data type.^
:parameter SINMAP
:text ^Source index method^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^STATIONS ^ 1 ^Use source station numbers to distinquish unique source ensembles.^) (^COORDINATES ^ 2 ^Use source coordinates to distinquish unique source ensembles.^) (^FFID ^ 3 ^Use field file IDs to distinquish unique source ensembles.^) (^LIVE SOURCE ^ 4 ^Use live source numbers to distinquish unique source ensembles.^))
:selected_item (^FFID ^ 3 ^Use field file IDs to distinquish unique source ensembles.^)
:value 3
:mouse_text ^Choose method of determining unique source ensembles.^
:parameter PRELOAD
:text ^Compare sources to previously extracted sources?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select 'No' to make sources distinct even if they match those already in the database^
:parameter SRFMAP
:text ^Receiver index method^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^COORDINATES ^ 2 ^Use receiver coordinates to distinquish unique receiver ensembles.^) (^STATIONS ^ 1 ^Use receiver station numbers to distinquish unique receiver ensembles.^))
:selected_item (^STATIONS ^ 1 ^Use receiver station numbers to distinquish unique receiver ensembles.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Choose method of determining unique receiver ensembles.^
:parameter OVERWRIT
:text ^Mode of operation^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^OVERWRITE^ 1 ^Overwrite database files if they exist. Use this option when creating files for the first time.^) (^APPEND ^ 0 ^Append new trace data to existing database files. Use this option when new traces are being added to the dataset.^) (^RESTART ^ 2 ^Restart from the last successfully completed extraction run. Database will be truncated to the restart positions
established in the last successful run.^))
:selected_item (^OVERWRITE^ 1 ^Overwrite database files if they exist. Use this option when creating files for the first time.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Choose method of file extraction.^
:parameter PRE_GEOM
:text ^Pre-geometry extraction?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^If Yes, the job will continue if insufficient header data exists to create the SRF OPF. (SIN and TRC are still created)^
:parameter CDPS
:text ^Extract CDP binning?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Choose Yes if the input data has valid CDP headers that you want to preserve. The CDP database will be created.^
:parameter MINCDP
:text ^ Minimum cdp bin in survey^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 7 0 NIL)
:value 0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^CDPs less than this value will be omitted. If 0, the program assumes the cdp header value of the first trace is the minimum.^
:parameter CALC_CMP
:text ^Calculate trace midpoint coordinates?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^TRC database entries CDP_X and CDP_Y will be calculated by averaging the shot and receiver coordinates. If CMP_X and CMP_Y exist in the headers, they will be overwritten.^
:parameter OFBS
:text ^Extract OFB binning?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Choose Yes if the input data has valid OFB_NO and OFB_CNTR headers that you want stored in the database.^
)
"

:text ^Select mode^

(DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CHANGE THE FORMAT OF EXISTING PROMAX HEADER WORDS; e.g. CHAN=1.0)^) (^Sequence renumber mode^ 2 ^Renumber sequences.^) (^Rotation & Translation^ 3 ^Coordinate translation and rotation.^) (^Change data attributes^ 4 ^Change global data parameters.^))

:selected_item (^No change^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Trace Header Math^
:enablep NIL
:name THDRMATH
:value_tab 60
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE MODE)) MODE1 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE OPERATE)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE OPERATE))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE2 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (IENSTRC CHEADNAM STARTVAL INC_VAL IRESET))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (IENSTRC CHEADNAM STARTVAL INC_VAL IRESET)))) (((VALUE MODE) (VALUE IRESET)) MODE2A (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (VALUE (QUOTE IRESET))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE CHDRESET)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE CHDRESET))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE3 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 3) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (ANGLE XSHIFT YSHIFT))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (ANGLE XSHIFT YSHIFT)))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE4 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 4) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (WARNING IVALID IGEOM IDTYP IDOMAIN ISORT))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (WARNING IVALID IGEOM IDTYP IDOMAIN ISORT)))))
:exec_data (EVAL (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 1) (QUOTE (^THDRMATH^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^:ProMAX $Id thdrmath.menu 46125 2010-11-30 01:11:19Z Gary :Wong $ $Revision :46125 $ $Date 2010-11-29 18:11:19 -0700 (Mon, 29 Nov 2010) $^) (^OPERATE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE OPERATE))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (QUOTE (^HEADER_RENUM^ (^GENERAL^ (^IENSTRC^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IENSTRC))) (^CHEADNAM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADNAM))) (^STARTVAL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE STARTVAL))) (^INC_VAL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE INC_VAL))) (^IRESET^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IRESET)) 1 0)) (^CHDRESET^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHDRESET))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 3) (QUOTE (^ROTATE^ (^GENERAL^ (^ANGLE ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ANGLE))) (^XSHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE XSHIFT))) (^YSHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE YSHIFT))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 4) (QUOTE (^DEITY^ (^GENERAL^ (^IVALID ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IVALID))) (^IGEOM ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IGEOM))) (^IDOMAIN^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IDOMAIN))) (^IDTYP ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IDTYP))) (^ISORT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ISORT))))))))):parameter MODE
:text ^Select mode^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Fixed equation mode^ 1 ^Define a fixed equation. (DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CHANGE THE FORMAT OF EXISTING PROMAX HEADER WORDS; e.g. CHAN=1.0)^) (^Sequence renumber mode^ 2 ^Renumber sequences.^) (^Rotation & Translation^ 3 ^Coordinate translation and rotation.^) (^Change data attributes^ 4 ^Change global data parameters.^))
:selected_item (^Fixed equation mode^ 1 ^Define a fixed equation. (DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CHANGE THE FORMAT OF EXISTING PROMAX HEADER WORDS; e.g. CHAN=1.0)^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select the math mode.^
:parameter OPERATE
:text ^ DEFINE trace header equation(s)^
:plot_label T
:type :edit
:type_desc (25 NIL 5 ^ :FORMAT C=A+B-C; C=NINT(A/B)+MOD(A,B); C=A*((B**2.0)/C+1.0)
 (Use semicolons to separate equations; See Help '?')

 EXAMPLES: NEW_ELEV = REC_ELEV + 100.0; SOU_SLOC = NINT(SOU_X) / 55
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 5)
:value ^tot_stat = 0.0;
uphole = 0.0;
depth = 0.0;^

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Inline Geom Header Load^
:enablep NIL
:name GEOM_LOAD
:value_tab 45
:plot_label T
:rules ((NIL MARINE (= (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^IMARINEz^) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (DO_STATS W_VEL))) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE DO_STATS) NIL) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE (DO_STATS W_VEL))))) (((VALUE IUSE_TRC)) TRC_VALID (VALUE (QUOTE IUSE_TRC)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE (CHEADER1 CHEADER2))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (CHEADER1 CHEADER2)))) (((VALUE IUSE_TRC) (VALUE CHEADER1)) SIN_HEADER (OR (VALUE (QUOTE IUSE_TRC)) (= (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADER1)) ^SIN ^)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE CHEADER2)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE CHEADER2))) (((VALUE W_VEL)) UNITS (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE W_VEL)) 0.001) (= (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^IUNITSz^) 1)) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE W_VEL) 4860.0)) (((VALUE W_VEL)) UNITS2 (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE W_VEL)) 0.001) (= (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^IUNITSz^) 3)) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE W_VEL) 1480.0)) (((VALUE CHEADER1) (VALUE CHEADER2)) SHOW_TIME (OR (= (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADER1)) ^TIM_SHOT^) (= (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADER2)) ^TIM_SHOT^)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (SHIFT TOLER))) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE (SHIFT TOLER)))) (((VALUE DO_STATS)) DO_STATS (VALUE (QUOTE DO_STATS)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE W_VEL)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE W_VEL))))
:exec_data (^GEOM_LOAD^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: geom_load.menu 41831 2007-09-01 20:51:38Z crs $ $Revision: 41831 $ $Date: 2007-09-01 15:51:38 -0500 (Sat, 01 Sep 2007) $^) (^DO_STATS^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE DO_STATS)) 1 0)) (^W_VEL ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE W_VEL))) (^IUSE_TRC^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IUSE_TRC)) 1 0)) (^KILL_CDP^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE KILL_CDP)) 1 0)) (^KILL_SRF^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE KILL_SRF)) 1 0)) (^IVERBOSE^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IVERBOSE)) 1 0)) (^CHEADER1^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADER1))) (^CHEADER2^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADER2))) (^SHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE SHIFT))) (^TOLER ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE TOLER))))):parameter DO_STATS
:text ^Compute and apply statics to sea level?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' to compute the source-receiver static to sea level and apply it.^
:parameter W_VEL
:text ^ Water velocity^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 7 0.001 NIL)
:value 1480.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^What is the water velocity (ft or m per sec) used for static correction to sea level.^
:parameter CHEADER1
:text ^Primary header to match database^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^FFID^ ^FFID ^ ^Match FFID from trace header to SIN database.^) (^SOU_SLOC^ ^SOU_SLOC^ ^Match SOU_SLOC from trace header to SIN database.^) (^SIN^ ^SIN ^ ^Match SIN from trace header to SIN database.^) (^SOURCE^ ^SOURCE ^ ^Match SOURCE from trace header to SIN database.^) (^S_LINE^ ^S_LINE ^ ^Match sail/swath line from trace header to SIN database.^) (^DAY_SHOT^ ^DAY_SHOT^ ^Match day of shot from trace header to SIN database.^) (^TIM_SHOT^ ^TIM_SHOT^ ^Match time of shot from trace header to SIN database.^))
:selected_item (^FFID^ ^FFID ^ ^Match FFID from trace header to SIN database.^)
:value ^FFID ^
:mouse_text ^Choose one of the primary headers to match the SIN database.^
:parameter CHEADER2
:text ^Secondary header to match database^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^None^ ^NONE ^ ^No secondary header match is required.^) (^S_LINE^ ^S_LINE ^ ^Match sail/swath line from trace header to SIN database.^) (^FFID^ ^FFID ^ ^Match FFID from trace header to SIN database.^) (^SOU_SLOC^ ^SOU_SLOC^ ^Match SOU_SLOC from trace header to SIN database.^) (^SOURCE^ ^SOURCE ^ ^Match SOURCE from trace header to SIN database.^) (^DAY_SHOT^ ^DAY_SHOT^ ^Match day of shot from trace header to SIN database.^) (^TIM_SHOT^ ^TIM_SHOT^ ^Match time of shot from trace header to SIN database.^))
:selected_item (^None^ ^NONE ^ ^No secondary header match is required.^)
:value ^NONE ^
:mouse_text ^Choose one of the secondary headers to match the SIN database.^
:parameter SHIFT
:text ^ Time shift^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 7 NIL NIL)
:value 0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^What time shift (in seconds) should be applied to the header in order to match the database entry?^
:parameter TOLER
:text ^ Time tolerance^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 7 0 NIL)
:value 0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^What tolerance (in seconds) is allowable for matching the headers and database entry for time of shot?^
:parameter IUSE_TRC
:text ^Match by valid trace number?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' to use valid trace numbers from the header to match the database. They must have been assigned previously.^
:parameter KILL_CDP
:text ^Drop traces with NULL CDP headers?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' to discard traces which have a NULL CDP header. (ex. traces that fell outside a bin space definition.)^
:parameter KILL_SRF
:text ^Drop traces with NULL receiver headers?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' to discard traces which have a NULL REC_SLOC header. (ex. traces that did not have an assigned receiver position.)^
:parameter IVERBOSE
:text ^Verbose diagnostics?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' to list shot and channel of every trace that had a null header loaded.^
)
"

 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 5)
:value ^offsetx=abs(sou_sloc-r_line)*12.5;
offsety=abs(srf_sloc-s_line)*25;^

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Trace Header Math^
:enablep NIL
:name THDRMATH
:value_tab 60
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE MODE)) MODE1 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE OPERATE)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE OPERATE))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE2 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (IENSTRC CHEADNAM STARTVAL INC_VAL IRESET))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (IENSTRC CHEADNAM STARTVAL INC_VAL IRESET)))) (((VALUE MODE) (VALUE IRESET)) MODE2A (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (VALUE (QUOTE IRESET))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE CHDRESET)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE CHDRESET))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE3 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 3) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (ANGLE XSHIFT YSHIFT))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (ANGLE XSHIFT YSHIFT)))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE4 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 4) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (WARNING IVALID IGEOM IDTYP IDOMAIN ISORT))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (WARNING IVALID IGEOM IDTYP IDOMAIN ISORT)))))
:exec_data (EVAL (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 1) (QUOTE (^THDRMATH^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^:ProMAX $Id thdrmath.menu 46125 2010-11-30 01:11:19Z Gary :Wong $ $Revision :46125 $ $Date 2010-11-29 18:11:19 -0700 (Mon, 29 Nov 2010) $^) (^OPERATE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE OPERATE))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (QUOTE (^HEADER_RENUM^ (^GENERAL^ (^IENSTRC^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IENSTRC))) (^CHEADNAM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADNAM))) (^STARTVAL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE STARTVAL))) (^INC_VAL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE INC_VAL))) (^IRESET^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IRESET)) 1 0)) (^CHDRESET^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHDRESET))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 3) (QUOTE (^ROTATE^ (^GENERAL^ (^ANGLE ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ANGLE))) (^XSHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE XSHIFT))) (^YSHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE YSHIFT))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 4) (QUOTE (^DEITY^ (^GENERAL^ (^IVALID ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IVALID))) (^IGEOM ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IGEOM))) (^IDOMAIN^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IDOMAIN))) (^IDTYP ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IDTYP))) (^ISORT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ISORT))))))))):parameter MODE
:text ^Select mode^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Fixed equation mode^ 1 ^Define a fixed equation. (DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CHANGE THE FORMAT OF EXISTING PROMAX HEADER WORDS; e.g. CHAN=1.0)^) (^Sequence renumber mode^ 2 ^Renumber sequences.^) (^Rotation & Translation^ 3 ^Coordinate translation and rotation.^) (^Change data attributes^ 4 ^Change global data parameters.^))
:selected_item (^Fixed equation mode^ 1 ^Define a fixed equation. (DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CHANGE THE FORMAT OF EXISTING PROMAX HEADER WORDS; e.g. CHAN=1.0)^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select the math mode.^
:parameter OPERATE
:text ^ DEFINE trace header equation(s)^
:plot_label T
:type :edit
:type_desc (25 NIL 5 ^ :FORMAT C=A+B-C; C=NINT(A/B)+MOD(A,B); C=A*((B**2.0)/C+1.0)
 (Use semicolons to separate equations; See Help '?')

 EXAMPLES: NEW_ELEV = REC_ELEV + 100.0; SOU_SLOC = NINT(SOU_X) / 55
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 5)

rec_y=rec_y-6000000;^

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Extract Database Files^
:enablep NIL
:name OPF_EXTRACT
:value_tab 54
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE MARINE)) SHOWSRF (= (VALUE (QUOTE MARINE)) 0) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE SRFMAP)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE SRFMAP))) (((VALUE MARINE)) SHOWCALC_CMP (= (VALUE (QUOTE MARINE)) 1) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE CALC_CMP)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE CALC_CMP))) (((VALUE OVERWRIT)) SHOWPRELOAD (= (VALUE (QUOTE OVERWRIT)) 1) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE PRELOAD)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE PRELOAD))) (((VALUE CDPS) (VALUE OVERWRIT)) SHOWMINCDP (AND (VALUE (QUOTE CDPS)) (= (VALUE (QUOTE OVERWRIT)) 1)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE MINCDP)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE MINCDP))))
:exec_data ((^OPF_EXTRACT^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: opf_extract.menu 44577 2009-07-29 16:44:43Z David Johnston $ $Revision: 44577 $ $Date: 2009-07-29 11:44:43 -0500 (Wed, 29 Jul 2009) $^) (^I3D^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE I3D)) 1 0)) (^MARINE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE MARINE))) (^SINMAP^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE SINMAP))) (^PRELOAD^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE PRELOAD)) 1 0)) (^SRFMAP^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE SRFMAP))) (^OVERWRIT^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE OVERWRIT))) (^PRE_GEOM^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE PRE_GEOM)) 1 0)) (^CDPS^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE CDPS)) 1 0)) (^MINCDP^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE MINCDP))) (^OFBS^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE OFBS)) 1 0)))) ((IF (AND (SHOWING (QUOTE CALC_CMP)) (VALUE (QUOTE CALC_CMP))) ^THDRMATH^ ^VOID^) (^GENERAL^ (^OPERATE^ :implicit ^CMP_X=(SOU_X+REC_X)/2.0^))) ((IF (AND (SHOWING (QUOTE CALC_CMP)) (VALUE (QUOTE CALC_CMP))) ^THDRMATH^ ^VOID^) (^GENERAL^ (^OPERATE^ :implicit ^CMP_Y=(SOU_Y+REC_Y)/2.0^))) ((IF (AND (SHOWING (QUOTE CALC_CMP)) (VALUE (QUOTE CALC_CMP))) ^DB_HDR_LOAD^ ^VOID^) (^GENERAL^ (^DIRECT^ :implicit 1) (^NUMPARMS^ :implicit 2) (^DB_PARM1^ :implicit (STRING_CONCATINATE ^TRC GEOMETRY CDP_X^)) (^DB_PARM2^ :implicit (STRING_CONCATINATE ^TRC GEOMETRY CDP_Y^)) (^HDR_VAL1^ :implicit ^CMP_X ^) (^HDR_VAL2^ :implicit ^CMP_Y ^)))):parameter I3D
:text ^Is this a 3D survey?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^Select Yes, if this is a 3D survey.^
:parameter MARINE
:text ^Data type^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^LAND ^ 0 ^Land data acquisition^) (^MARINE ^ 1 ^Marine data acquisition^))
:selected_item (^LAND ^ 0 ^Land data acquisition^)
:value 0
:mouse_text ^Choose either land or marine data type.^
:parameter SINMAP
:text ^Source index method^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^STATIONS ^ 1 ^Use source station numbers to distinquish unique source ensembles.^) (^COORDINATES ^ 2 ^Use source coordinates to distinquish unique source ensembles.^) (^FFID ^ 3 ^Use field file IDs to distinquish unique source ensembles.^) (^LIVE SOURCE ^ 4 ^Use live source numbers to distinquish unique source ensembles.^))
:selected_item (^FFID ^ 3 ^Use field file IDs to distinquish unique source ensembles.^)
:value 3
:mouse_text ^Choose method of determining unique source ensembles.^
:parameter PRELOAD
:text ^Compare sources to previously extracted sources?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select 'No' to make sources distinct even if they match those already in the database^
:parameter SRFMAP
:text ^Receiver index method^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^COORDINATES ^ 2 ^Use receiver coordinates to distinquish unique receiver ensembles.^) (^STATIONS ^ 1 ^Use receiver station numbers to distinquish unique receiver ensembles.^))
:selected_item (^STATIONS ^ 1 ^Use receiver station numbers to distinquish unique receiver ensembles.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Choose method of determining unique receiver ensembles.^
:parameter OVERWRIT
:text ^Mode of operation^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^OVERWRITE^ 1 ^Overwrite database files if they exist. Use this option when creating files for the first time.^) (^APPEND ^ 0 ^Append new trace data to existing database files. Use this option when new traces are being added to the dataset.^) (^RESTART ^ 2 ^Restart from the last successfully completed extraction run. Database will be truncated to the restart positions
established in the last successful run.^))
:selected_item (^OVERWRITE^ 1 ^Overwrite database files if they exist. Use this option when creating files for the first time.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Choose method of file extraction.^
:parameter PRE_GEOM
:text ^Pre-geometry extraction?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^If Yes, the job will continue if insufficient header data exists to create the SRF OPF. (SIN and TRC are still created)^
:parameter CDPS
:text ^Extract CDP binning?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Choose Yes if the input data has valid CDP headers that you want to preserve. The CDP database will be created.^
:parameter MINCDP
:text ^ Minimum cdp bin in survey^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 7 0 NIL)
:value 0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^CDPs less than this value will be omitted. If 0, the program assumes the cdp header value of the first trace is the minimum.^
:parameter CALC_CMP
:text ^Calculate trace midpoint coordinates?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^TRC database entries CDP_X and CDP_Y will be calculated by averaging the shot and receiver coordinates. If CMP_X and CMP_Y exist in the headers, they will be overwritten.^
:parameter OFBS
:text ^Extract OFB binning?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Choose Yes if the input data has valid OFB_NO and OFB_CNTR headers that you want stored in the database.^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Trace Header Math^
:enablep T
:name THDRMATH
:value_tab 60
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE MODE)) MODE1 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE OPERATE)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE OPERATE))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE2 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (IENSTRC CHEADNAM STARTVAL INC_VAL IRESET))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (IENSTRC CHEADNAM STARTVAL INC_VAL IRESET)))) (((VALUE MODE) (VALUE IRESET)) MODE2A (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (VALUE (QUOTE IRESET))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE CHDRESET)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE CHDRESET))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE3 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 3) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (ANGLE XSHIFT YSHIFT))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (ANGLE XSHIFT YSHIFT)))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE4 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 4) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (WARNING IVALID IGEOM IDTYP IDOMAIN ISORT))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (WARNING IVALID IGEOM IDTYP IDOMAIN ISORT)))))
:exec_data (EVAL (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 1) (QUOTE (^THDRMATH^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^:ProMAX $Id thdrmath.menu 46125 2010-11-30 01:11:19Z Gary :Wong $ $Revision :46125 $ $Date 2010-11-29 18:11:19 -0700 (Mon, 29 Nov 2010) $^) (^OPERATE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE OPERATE))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (QUOTE (^HEADER_RENUM^ (^GENERAL^ (^IENSTRC^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IENSTRC))) (^CHEADNAM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADNAM))) (^STARTVAL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE STARTVAL))) (^INC_VAL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE INC_VAL))) (^IRESET^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IRESET)) 1 0)) (^CHDRESET^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHDRESET))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 3) (QUOTE (^ROTATE^ (^GENERAL^ (^ANGLE ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ANGLE))) (^XSHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE XSHIFT))) (^YSHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE YSHIFT))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 4) (QUOTE (^DEITY^ (^GENERAL^ (^IVALID ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IVALID))) (^IGEOM ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IGEOM))) (^IDOMAIN^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IDOMAIN))) (^IDTYP ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IDTYP))) (^ISORT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ISORT))))))))):parameter MODE

(DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CHANGE THE FORMAT OF EXISTING PROMAX HEADER WORDS; e.g. CHAN=1.0)^) (^Sequence renumber mode^ 2 ^Renumber sequences.^) (^Rotation & Translation^ 3 ^Coordinate translation and rotation.^) (^Change data attributes^ 4 ^Change global data parameters.^))

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Inline Geom Header Load^
:enablep T
:name GEOM_LOAD
:value_tab 45
:plot_label T
:rules ((NIL MARINE (= (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^IMARINEz^) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (DO_STATS W_VEL))) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE DO_STATS) NIL) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE (DO_STATS W_VEL))))) (((VALUE IUSE_TRC)) TRC_VALID (VALUE (QUOTE IUSE_TRC)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE (CHEADER1 CHEADER2))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (CHEADER1 CHEADER2)))) (((VALUE IUSE_TRC) (VALUE CHEADER1)) SIN_HEADER (OR (VALUE (QUOTE IUSE_TRC)) (= (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADER1)) ^SIN ^)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE CHEADER2)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE CHEADER2))) (((VALUE W_VEL)) UNITS (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE W_VEL)) 0.001) (= (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^IUNITSz^) 1)) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE W_VEL) 4860.0)) (((VALUE W_VEL)) UNITS2 (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE W_VEL)) 0.001) (= (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^IUNITSz^) 3)) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE W_VEL) 1480.0)) (((VALUE CHEADER1) (VALUE CHEADER2)) SHOW_TIME (OR (= (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADER1)) ^TIM_SHOT^) (= (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADER2)) ^TIM_SHOT^)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (SHIFT TOLER))) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE (SHIFT TOLER)))) (((VALUE DO_STATS)) DO_STATS (VALUE (QUOTE DO_STATS)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE W_VEL)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE W_VEL))))
:exec_data (^GEOM_LOAD^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: geom_load.menu 41831 2007-09-01 20:51:38Z crs $ $Revision: 41831 $ $Date: 2007-09-01 15:51:38 -0500 (Sat, 01 Sep 2007) $^) (^DO_STATS^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE DO_STATS)) 1 0)) (^W_VEL ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE W_VEL))) (^IUSE_TRC^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IUSE_TRC)) 1 0)) (^KILL_CDP^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE KILL_CDP)) 1 0)) (^KILL_SRF^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE KILL_SRF)) 1 0)) (^IVERBOSE^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IVERBOSE)) 1 0)) (^CHEADER1^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADER1))) (^CHEADER2^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADER2))) (^SHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE SHIFT))) (^TOLER ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE TOLER))))):parameter DO_STATS
:text ^Compute and apply statics to sea level?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:showp NIL

:parameter W_VEL
:text ^ Water velocity^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 7 0.001 NIL)
:value 1480.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^What is the water velocity (ft or m per sec) used for static correction to sea level.^
:parameter CHEADER1
:text ^Primary header to match database^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^FFID^ ^FFID ^ ^Match FFID from trace header to SIN database.^) (^SOU_SLOC^ ^SOU_SLOC^ ^Match SOU_SLOC from trace header to SIN database.^) (^SIN^ ^SIN ^ ^Match SIN from trace header to SIN database.^) (^SOURCE^ ^SOURCE ^ ^Match SOURCE from trace header to SIN database.^) (^S_LINE^ ^S_LINE ^ ^Match sail/swath line from trace header to SIN database.^) (^DAY_SHOT^ ^DAY_SHOT^ ^Match day of shot from trace header to SIN database.^) (^TIM_SHOT^ ^TIM_SHOT^ ^Match time of shot from trace header to SIN database.^))
:selected_item (^FFID^ ^FFID ^ ^Match FFID from trace header to SIN database.^)
:value ^FFID ^

:parameter CHEADER2

:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^None^ ^NONE ^ ^No secondary header match is required.^) (^S_LINE^ ^S_LINE ^ ^Match sail/swath line from trace header to SIN database.^) (^FFID^ ^FFID ^ ^Match FFID from trace header to SIN database.^) (^SOU_SLOC^ ^SOU_SLOC^ ^Match SOU_SLOC from trace header to SIN database.^) (^SOURCE^ ^SOURCE ^ ^Match SOURCE from trace header to SIN database.^) (^DAY_SHOT^ ^DAY_SHOT^ ^Match day of shot from trace header to SIN database.^) (^TIM_SHOT^ ^TIM_SHOT^ ^Match time of shot from trace header to SIN database.^))
:selected_item (^None^ ^NONE ^ ^No secondary header match is required.^)
:value ^NONE ^
:mouse_text ^Choose one of the secondary headers to match the SIN database.^
:parameter SHIFT

:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 7 NIL NIL)

:showp NIL

:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 7 0 NIL)
:value 0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^What tolerance (in seconds) is allowable for matching the headers and database entry for time of shot?^
:parameter IUSE_TRC
:text ^Match by valid trace number?^

 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 3)

:text ^Output Dataset Filename^
:type :function
:type_desc (DATASET_LIST DATASETS)
:selected_item ^01.05 raw field-geom ffid-4001-8000^
:value ^28648659^
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select/add the dataset file description for the output dataset you wish to create. (Up to 35 chars.)^
:properties (:supported_formats (^PROMAX^ ^PROMAX_SMART^ ^PROMAX_TAPE^)
 )
:parameter STATUS
:text ^New, or Existing, File?^
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^New^ 1 ^Create an entirely new file. Delete an old file with this name if it exists. *DO NOT USE IF OUTPUT = INPUT FILE!*^) (^Overwrite^ 2 ^This file already exists. Overwrite the traces in the original sort with this newer version of the 'same' data.^) (^Append^ 3 ^This file already exists. Add these new traces to the end of this file.^))
:selected_item (^New^ 1 ^Create an entirely new file. Delete an old file with this name if it exists. *DO NOT USE IF OUTPUT = INPUT FILE!*^)

:text ^Record length to output^
:type :typein

:value 0.0
:mouse_text ^The trace length in milliseconds to output. The default of 0.0 means to output all available data samples.^
:parameter COMPRESS
:text ^Trace sample format^
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^16 bit^ 1 ^Write trace samples as 16-bit integers with scalars every 100 samples.^) (^32 bit^ 0 ^Write trace samples as 32-bit IEEE floating point numbers.^) (^8 bit^ 2 ^Write trace samples as 8-bit integers with scalars every 100 samples.^))
:selected_item (^16 bit^ 1 ^Write trace samples as 16-bit integers with scalars every 100 samples.^)
:value 1

:mouse_text ^Do you wish to use secondary disk storage to store the data (rather than filling the primary storage area)?^
)
"

:parameter ITERATE
:text ^Read the data multiple times?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Do you wish to read the data multiple times, from beginning to end?^
:parameter DISKITER
:text ^ Number of iterations^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 6 1 NIL)
:value 2
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Enter the number of times that you wish to read the data.^
:parameter THDRONLY
:text ^Process trace headers only?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Do you wish to process trace headers only (for header math, loading geometry info, etc.)?^
:parameter SR_OPTION
:text ^Override input data's sample interval?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Set to 'Yes' if your input data's sample interval is NOT correct on disk and you need to OVERRIDE it to continue!^
:parameter SAMPRATE
:text ^ Correct sample interval^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 6 0.0 NIL)
:value 0.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Enter the correct sample interval (in milliseconds) of your input data.^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Inline Sort^
:enablep NIL
:name INLINE_SORT
:value_tab 36
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE N_BUFFER)) RULE_N_BUFFER_DEF (= (VALUE (QUOTE N_BUFFER)) -1) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE N_BUFFER) (* (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^MAXCPSz^) (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^NTRCDPz^)))) (((VALUE MAX_DTRZ)) RULE_MAX_DTRZ_DEF (= (VALUE (QUOTE MAX_DTRZ)) -1) (SET_VALUE (QUOTE MAX_DTRZ) (* (DB_PARMGET_LINE ^NTRCDPz^) 1))) (((VALUE SORTKEY2)) RULE_KEY2_NONE (= (VALUE (QUOTE SORTKEY2)) ^NONE ^) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE SORTKEY3) ^NONE ^) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE SORTKEY3)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE S_ORDER2))) (PROGN (DO_SHOW (QUOTE SORTKEY3)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE S_ORDER2)))) (((VALUE SORTKEY3)) RULE_KEY3_NONE (= (VALUE (QUOTE SORTKEY3)) ^NONE ^) (PROGN (SET_VALUE (QUOTE SORTKEY4) ^NONE ^) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE SORTKEY4)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE S_ORDER3))) (PROGN (DO_SHOW (QUOTE SORTKEY4)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE S_ORDER3)))) (((VALUE SORTKEY4)) RULE_KEY4_NONE (= (VALUE (QUOTE SORTKEY4)) ^NONE ^) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE S_ORDER4)) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE S_ORDER4))) (((SHOWP AUTOTEST) (SHOWP AUTOTERT)) RULE_AUTOTEST (PROGN (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE AUTOTEST)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE AUTOTERT)))))
:exec_data (^INLINE_SORT^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: inline_sort.menu 44577 2009-07-29 16:44:43Z David Johnston $ $Revision: 44577 $ $Date: 2009-07-29 11:44:43 -0500 (Wed, 29 Jul 2009) $^) (^SORTKEY1^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE SORTKEY1))) (^SORTKEY2^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE SORTKEY2))) (^SORTKEY3^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE SORTKEY3))) (^SORTKEY4^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE SORTKEY4))) (^S_ORDER1^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE S_ORDER1))) (^S_ORDER2^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE S_ORDER2))) (^S_ORDER3^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE S_ORDER3))) (^S_ORDER4^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE S_ORDER4))) (^MAX_DTRZ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE MAX_DTRZ))) (^N_BUFFER^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE N_BUFFER))) (^ENDENSKY^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ENDENSKY))) (^MAXPRINT^ :implicit 1000) (^MEDIA^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE MEDIA))) (^COMPRESS^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE COMPRESS)) 1 0)) (^MULTPASS^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE MULTPASS)) 1 0)) (^AUTOTEST^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE AUTOTEST)) 1 0)) (^AUTOTERT^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE AUTOTERT))))):parameter SORTKEY1
:text ^Select new PRIMARY sort key^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc (HEADER_LIST HEADERS)
:selected_item (^Field file ID number^ ^FFID ^ ^FFID ^)
:value ^FFID ^
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select a header entry from the headers menu as the new PRIMARY sort key.^
:parameter S_ORDER1
:text ^PRIMARY sort order^
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Ascending ^ 1 ^Output ensembles in ASCENDING order.^) (^Descending^ -1 ^Output ensembles in DESCENDING order.^))
:selected_item (^Ascending ^ 1 ^Output ensembles in ASCENDING order.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^This dictates the order of the output ensembles.^
:parameter SORTKEY2
:text ^Select new SECONDARY sort key^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc (HEADER_LIST HEADERS)
:selected_item (^Receiver line number^ ^R_LINE ^ ^R_LINE ^)
:value ^R_LINE ^
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select a header entry from the headers menu as the new SECONDARY sort key.^
:parameter S_ORDER2
:text ^SECONDARY sort order^
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Ascending ^ 1 ^Output ensembles in ASCENDING order.^) (^Descending^ -1 ^Output ensembles in DESCENDING order.^))
:selected_item (^Ascending ^ 1 ^Output ensembles in ASCENDING order.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^This dictates the order of the output ensembles.^
:parameter SORTKEY3
:text ^Select new TERTIARY sort key^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc (HEADER_LIST HEADERS)
:selected_item (^External receiver location no.^ ^SRF_SLOC^ ^SRF_SLOC^)
:value ^SRF_SLOC^
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select a header entry from the headers menu as the new TERTIARY sort key.^
:parameter S_ORDER3
:text ^TERTIARY sort order^
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Ascending ^ 1 ^Output traces with the secondary key in ASCENDING order.^) (^Descending^ -1 ^Output traces with the secondary key in DESCENDING order.^))
:selected_item (^Ascending ^ 1 ^Output traces with the secondary key in ASCENDING order.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^This dictates the order of traces within each output ensemble.^
:parameter SORTKEY4
:text ^Select new QUATERNARY sort key^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc (HEADER_LIST HEADERS)
:selected_item ^No trace header entry selected^
:value ^NONE ^
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select a header entry from the headers menu as the new QUATERNARY sort key.^
:parameter S_ORDER4
:text ^QUATERNARY sort order^
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Ascending ^ 1 ^Output traces with the secondary key in ASCENDING order.^) (^Descending^ -1 ^Output traces with the secondary key in DESCENDING order.^))
:selected_item (^Ascending ^ 1 ^Output traces with the secondary key in ASCENDING order.^)
:value 1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^This dictates the order of traces within each output ensemble.^
:parameter MAX_DTRZ
:text ^Maximum traces per output ensemble^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 5 1 NIL)
:value 20000
:mouse_text ^What is the maximum number of traces per ensemble AFTER sorting? For a CDP sort, this is the maximum fold.^
:parameter N_BUFFER
:text ^Number of traces in buffer^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 8 NIL NIL)
:value 37000000
:mouse_text ^How many traces must be buffered? For a normal CDP sort, this is max fold multiplied by chans per record.^
:parameter MEDIA
:text ^Buffer type^
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Disk^ 1 ^Buffer traces on disk^) (^Memory^ 2 ^Buffer traces in memory^))
:selected_item (^Memory^ 2 ^Buffer traces in memory^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to rotate between choices for buffering traces to disk (large but slow) or memory (small but fast).^
:parameter ENDENSKY
:text ^Sort key which controls End-Of-Ensemble^
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Primary^ 1 ^End-Ensemble set when PRIMARY key changes^) (^Secondary^ 2 ^End-Ensemble set when SECONDARY key changes^) (^Tertiary^ 3 ^End-Ensemble set when TERTIARY key changes^) (^Quaternary^ 4 ^End-Ensemble set when QUATERNARY key changes^))
:selected_item (^Primary^ 1 ^End-Ensemble set when PRIMARY key changes^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to rotate between choices for End-Of-Ensemble key. Line-Segment-End will be the key above the End-Of-Ensemble key.^
:parameter COMPRESS
:text ^Compress data before sorting?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' to reduce storage requirements by compressing the data before sorting.^
:parameter MULTPASS
:text ^Multiple pass?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' if buffer is not big enough for sort. Refer to help file for procedure.^
:parameter AUTOTEST
:text ^Run in AUTOTEST mode?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select 'Yes' if sort should stay the same as input primary/secondary keys and add DS_SEQNO as tertiary sort key^
:parameter AUTOTERT
:text ^AUTOTEST tertiary sort key^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 9)
:value ^TLIVE_S^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Enter tertiary sort key name for autotests^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Trace Header Math^
:enablep NIL
:name THDRMATH
:value_tab 60
:plot_label T
:rules ((((VALUE MODE)) MODE1 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE OPERATE)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE OPERATE))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE2 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (IENSTRC CHEADNAM STARTVAL INC_VAL IRESET))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (IENSTRC CHEADNAM STARTVAL INC_VAL IRESET)))) (((VALUE MODE) (VALUE IRESET)) MODE2A (AND (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (VALUE (QUOTE IRESET))) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE CHDRESET)) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE CHDRESET))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE3 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 3) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (ANGLE XSHIFT YSHIFT))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (ANGLE XSHIFT YSHIFT)))) (((VALUE MODE)) MODE4 (= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 4) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE (WARNING IVALID IGEOM IDTYP IDOMAIN ISORT))) (DONT_SHOW (QUOTE (WARNING IVALID IGEOM IDTYP IDOMAIN ISORT)))))
:exec_data (EVAL (COND ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 1) (QUOTE (^THDRMATH^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^:ProMAX $Id thdrmath.menu 46125 2010-11-30 01:11:19Z Gary :Wong $ $Revision :46125 $ $Date 2010-11-29 18:11:19 -0700 (Mon, 29 Nov 2010) $^) (^OPERATE^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE OPERATE))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 2) (QUOTE (^HEADER_RENUM^ (^GENERAL^ (^IENSTRC^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IENSTRC))) (^CHEADNAM^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHEADNAM))) (^STARTVAL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE STARTVAL))) (^INC_VAL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE INC_VAL))) (^IRESET^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE IRESET)) 1 0)) (^CHDRESET^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE CHDRESET))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 3) (QUOTE (^ROTATE^ (^GENERAL^ (^ANGLE ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ANGLE))) (^XSHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE XSHIFT))) (^YSHIFT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE YSHIFT))))))) ((= (VALUE (QUOTE MODE)) 4) (QUOTE (^DEITY^ (^GENERAL^ (^IVALID ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IVALID))) (^IGEOM ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IGEOM))) (^IDOMAIN^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IDOMAIN))) (^IDTYP ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE IDTYP))) (^ISORT ^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE ISORT))))))))):parameter MODE
:text ^Select mode^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^Fixed equation mode^ 1 ^Define a fixed equation. (DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CHANGE THE FORMAT OF EXISTING PROMAX HEADER WORDS; e.g. CHAN=1.0)^) (^Sequence renumber mode^ 2 ^Renumber sequences.^) (^Rotation & Translation^ 3 ^Coordinate translation and rotation.^) (^Change data attributes^ 4 ^Change global data parameters.^))
:selected_item (^Sequence renumber mode^ 2 ^Renumber sequences.^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^Select the math mode.^
:parameter OPERATE
:text ^ DEFINE trace header equation(s)^
:plot_label T
:type :edit
:type_desc (25 NIL 5 ^ :FORMAT C=A+B-C; C=NINT(A/B)+MOD(A,B); C=A*((B**2.0)/C+1.0)
 (Use semicolons to separate equations; See Help '?')

 EXAMPLES: NEW_ELEV = REC_ELEV + 100.0; SOU_SLOC = NINT(SOU_X) / 55
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 5)
:value ^new_elev = rec_elev + 100^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to access the text editor and define equations to overwrite old header words or create new ones.^
:parameter IENSTRC
:text ^ Renumber ensembles or traces?^
:plot_label T
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^ENSEMBLES^ 1 ^Renumber ensembles in the order in which they are input.^) (^TRACES ^ 2 ^Renumber headers of traces within ensembles, renumbering starts at the begining of each ensemble.^))
:selected_item (^TRACES ^ 2 ^Renumber headers of traces within ensembles, renumbering starts at the begining of each ensemble.^)
:value 2
:mouse_text ^You can renumber either the ensemble number or the traces within ensembles.^
:parameter CHEADNAM
:text ^ SELECT trace header word^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc (HEADER_LIST HEADERS)
:selected_item (^Recording channel number^ ^CHAN ^ ^CHAN ^)
:value ^CHAN ^
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select a header word from the headers menu as the HEADER NAME key for renumbering.^
:parameter STARTVAL
:text ^ Starting value^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 12)
:value ^1^
:mouse_text ^Value to assign to first trace header encountered, entry for floating point trace headers MUST include a decimal.^
:parameter INC_VAL
:text ^ Increment value^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:string 12)
:value ^1^
:mouse_text ^Value by which to increment successive headers, entry for floating point header values MUST include a decimal.^
:parameter IRESET
:text ^ Reset the Starting value at header change?^
:plot_label T
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^ Do you want to reset the renumber counter to the Starting value when a different trace header changes value?^
:parameter CHDRESET
:text ^ SELECT reset renumber trace header word^
:plot_label T
:type :function
:type_desc (HEADER_LIST HEADERS)
:selected_item (^Field file ID number^ ^FFID ^ ^FFID ^)
:value ^FFID ^
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select a header word from the headers menu as the HEADER NAME key for resetting.^
:parameter ANGLE
:text ^ Rotation angle^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 8 0.0 360.0)
:value 0.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Clockwise rotation angle of new coordinate relative to the original axes. (0.0 - 360.0 degrees)^
:parameter XSHIFT
:text ^ X coordinate shift^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 8 NIL NIL)
:value 0.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Value of X coordinate in old system of the new, translated origin. (0.0 = no shift in X position)^
:parameter YSHIFT
:text ^ Y coordinate shift^
:plot_label T
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 8 NIL NIL)
:value 0.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Value of Y coordinate in the old system of the new, translated origin. (0.0 = no shift in Y position)^
:parameter WARNING
:text ^** CHANGE THESE ONLY IF YOU UNDERSTAND THE CONSEQUENCES **^
:showp NIL
:parameter IVALID
:text ^ Trace number valid?^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^Valid ^ 1 ^Trace numbers are valid and can be used to reference the database.^) (^Invalid ^ 0 ^Trace numbers are NOT valid and can not be used to reference the database.^))
:selected_item (^No change^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Set the global runtime flag for valid database. (i.e. trace numbers are unique and match the database)^
:parameter IGEOM
:text ^ Geometry valid?^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^Valid ^ 1 ^Geometry loaded in the trace header match the database.^) (^Invalid ^ 0 ^Geometry loaded in the trace header do NOT match the database.^))
:selected_item (^No change^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Set the global runtime flag for valid geometry. (i.e. geometry in the trace headers matches the database)^
:parameter IDOMAIN
:text ^ Domain of data^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^T-X ^ 0 ^Normal time-space domain.^) (^F-X ^ 1 ^Frequency-space domain.^) (^F-T ^ 2 ^Frequency-time domain.^) (^F-K ^ 3 ^Frequency-wavenumber domain.^) (^Tau-P ^ 4 ^Tau-P (time-ray-parameter) domain.^) (^Depth ^ 7 ^Depth-space domain.^))
:selected_item (^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select new data type.^
:parameter IDTYP
:text ^ Data type^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^Normal unstacked ^ 0 ^Normal unstacked data.^) (^Normal stacked ^ 7 ^Normal stacked data.^) (^Unstacked trasformed^ 2 ^Transformed unstacked - e.g., frequency dom. - data^) (^Stacked transformed ^ 3 ^Transformed stacked - e.g., frequency domain - data^))
:selected_item (^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select data type.^
:parameter ISORT
:text ^ Primary sort of data^
:plot_label T
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^) (^CDP Sort ^ 1 ^CDP bin number sorted data.^) (^SIN Sort ^ 2 ^Shot index number sorted data.^) (^RECSLOC Sort^ 3 ^Receiver surface station sorted data.^) (^Offset Sort ^ 4 ^Shot to receiver signed offset sorted data.^) (^CHAN Sort ^ 5 ^Channel number sorted data.^) (^ILINE Sort ^ 7 ^Inline number sorted data.^) (^XLINE Sort ^ 8 ^Crossline number sorted data.^))
:selected_item (^No change ^ -1 ^Leave flag as is.^)
:value -1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Select new primary sort order.^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Disk Data Output^
:enablep NIL
:name DISKWRITE
:value_tab 50
:plot_label NIL
:rules ((((VALUE STATUS)) SHOW_COMPRESS (= (VALUE (QUOTE STATUS)) 1) (DO_SHOW (QUOTE COMPRESS)) (DO_NOT_SHOW (QUOTE COMPRESS))))
:exec_data (^DISKWRITE^ (^GENERAL^ (^version^ :implicit ^ProMAX $Id: diskwrite.menu 44577 2009-07-29 16:44:43Z David Johnston $ $Revision: 44577 $ $Date: 2009-07-29 11:44:43 -0500 (Wed, 29 Jul 2009) $^) (^VERSION^ :implicit 0.1) (^LABEL^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE DESCRIPT))) (^DESCRIPT^ :implicit (SELECTED_ITEM (QUOTE DESCRIPT))) (^STATUS^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE STATUS))) (^TMAX^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE TMAX))) (^ALTSTORE^ :implicit (IF (VALUE (QUOTE ALTSTORE)) 1 0)) (^COMPRESS^ :implicit (VALUE (QUOTE COMPRESS))))):parameter DESCRIPT
:text ^Output Dataset Filename^
:type :function
:type_desc (DATASET_LIST DATASETS)
:selected_item ^01.05 raw field-geom ffid-4001-8000 sort-ffid^
:value ^01435285^
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select/add the dataset file description for the output dataset you wish to create. (Up to 35 chars.)^
:properties (:supported_formats (^PROMAX^ ^PROMAX_SMART^ ^PROMAX_TAPE^)
 )
:parameter STATUS
:text ^New, or Existing, File?^
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^New^ 1 ^Create an entirely new file. Delete an old file with this name if it exists. *DO NOT USE IF OUTPUT = INPUT FILE!*^) (^Overwrite^ 2 ^This file already exists. Overwrite the traces in the original sort with this newer version of the 'same' data.^) (^Append^ 3 ^This file already exists. Add these new traces to the end of this file.^))
:selected_item (^New^ 1 ^Create an entirely new file. Delete an old file with this name if it exists. *DO NOT USE IF OUTPUT = INPUT FILE!*^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Create a new file, write over an existing file with a new version of the 'same' data, or add new data to the end.^
:parameter TMAX
:text ^Record length to output^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 7 0.0 NIL)
:value 0.0
:mouse_text ^The trace length in milliseconds to output. The default of 0.0 means to output all available data samples.^
:parameter COMPRESS
:text ^Trace sample format^
:type :pop_choose
:type_desc ((^16 bit^ 1 ^Write trace samples as 16-bit integers with scalars every 100 samples.^) (^32 bit^ 0 ^Write trace samples as 32-bit IEEE floating point numbers.^) (^8 bit^ 2 ^Write trace samples as 8-bit integers with scalars every 100 samples.^))
:selected_item (^16 bit^ 1 ^Write trace samples as 16-bit integers with scalars every 100 samples.^)
:value 1
:mouse_text ^Select a format for trace samples. Samples in memory are always represented as floating point number.^
:parameter ALTSTORE
:text ^Skip primary disk storage?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^Do you wish to use secondary disk storage to store the data (rather than filling the primary storage area)?^
)
"

parset.name: MENUDATA
parset.par:
"(:label
^Disk Data Input^
:enablep T
:name DISKREAD2
:value_tab 40

:text ^Select dataset^

:selected_item :none
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use Mouse Button 1 to select a dataset from another line/survey.^

:text ^Propagate input file history^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^Yes ^ T)
:value T
:mouse_text ^Selecting 'No' will exclude the history of this dataset from that attributed to any dataset output in this flow^
:parameter SORTOPT
:text ^Trace read option^
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Get All^ -1 ^Read in all traces in the dataset sequentially. (In their current sort order.)^) (^Sort ^ 1 ^Input traces will be sorted to the requested order, based on one or more header entries.^))
:selected_item (^Get All^ -1 ^Read in all traces in the dataset sequentially. (In their current sort order.)^)
:value -1
:mouse_text ^Input traces can be sorted using header entries, or ALL traces in the dataset can be sequentially read in.^

:text ^Interactive Data Access?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Interactive Data Access may be used for certain processing modules to select new input traces on the fly.^
:parameter PKEYNAM
:text ^ Select primary trace header entry^
:type :function
:type_desc (HEADER_LIST HEADERS)
:selected_item (^Source index number (internal)*^ ^SIN ^ ^SIN ^)
:value ^SIN ^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select a header entry from the HEADERS menu to use as the primary key for specifying 'Sort' traces.^
:parameter SKEYNAM
:text ^ Select secondary trace header entry^
:type :function
:type_desc (HEADER_LIST HEADERS)
:selected_item (^No trace header selected^ ^NONE ^ ^NONE ^)
:value ^NONE ^
:showp NIL

:parameter TKEYNAM
:text ^ Select tertiary trace header entry^

:type_desc (HEADER_LIST HEADERS)
:selected_item (^No trace header selected^ ^NONE ^ ^NONE ^)
:value ^NONE ^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to select a header entry from the headers menu to use as the tertiary key for specifying 'Sort' traces.^
:parameter KEYLIST
:text ^ Sort order list for dataset^
:type :edit
:type_desc (25 NIL 5 ^ FORMAT: Primary Header Entry Value: Secondary Value: Tertiary Value /
 EXAMPLES: 1-10; 11-20(2):1,60,61,120 / 21,25:1-120; 101.5:101-200:-3300--55/
 HELP: EMACS Editor Widget (scroll with down/up arrow keys)
 CURSOR MOVEMENT: Use the arrow keys:->,<-,etc.;Point the mouse cursor,click B1
 CM: Ctrl-A		Move the cursor to the BEGINNING of the current line
 CM: Ctrl-E		Move the cursor to the END of the current line
 EDITING: All keyboard entry is in 'insert' mode
 E: Backspace, Delete keys	Delete one character to the LEFT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-D			Delete one character to the RIGHT of the cursor
 E: Ctrl-K		KILL to the end of the line (from the cursor)
 E: Ctrl-Y		YANK back the contents of the kill buffer; 'Cut and 
			 paste'; (Can move the cursor first) ^ 3)
:value ^*/^
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Use MB1 to access the editor and define the input trace list. Use an asterisk (*) to default any header's values ( Ex: FFID,CHAN; *:*/ )^
:parameter MEM_SORT
:text ^ Presort in memory or on disk?^
:type :circular
:type_desc ((^Memory^ 1 ^Presort traces in memory (faster, but may exhaust memory resources).^) (^Disk^ 0 ^Presort traces on disk (slower, but capable of very large sorts)^))
:selected_item (^Memory^ 1 ^Presort traces in memory (faster, but may exhaust memory resources).^)
:value 1
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^The input presort list can be created in memory or on disk, depending on resource requirements.^
:parameter ITERATE
:text ^Read the data multiple times?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Do you wish to read the data multiple times, from beginning to end?^
:parameter DISKITER
:text ^ Number of iterations^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:int 6 1 NIL)
:value 2
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Enter the number of times that you wish to read the data.^
:parameter THDRONLY
:text ^Process trace headers only?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Do you wish to process trace headers only (for header math, loading geometry info, etc.)?^
:parameter SR_OPTION
:text ^Override input data's sample interval?^
:type :boolean
:type_desc ((^Yes ^ T) (^No^ NIL))
:selected_item (^No^ NIL)
:mouse_text ^Set to 'Yes' if your input data's sample interval is NOT correct on disk and you need to OVERRIDE it to continue!^
:parameter SAMPRATE
:text ^ Correct sample interval^
:type :typein
:type_desc (:real 6 0.0 NIL)
:value 0.0
:showp NIL
:mouse_text ^Enter the correct sample interval (in milliseconds) of your input data.^
)
"
